original: yon tan brgyad la sems kun tu dag pa dang / rnam par dkar ba dang / skyon med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / 'jam pa dang / las su @81a * //
analyzed: yon tan brgyad la sems kun tu dag pa dang / rnam par dkar ba dang / skyon med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / 'jam pa dang / las su @81a * //
translated: The mind is completely purified, completely white, faultless, free from afflictions, gentle, workable, and capable of focusing on the object of meditation without grasping.üîΩ

original: rung ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob pa'o //
translated: The mind becomes completely pure, completely bright, completely faultless, completely free of afflictions, completely gentle, completely serviceable, completely stable, and completely unshakable.

original: de la chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa la chags pa dang bral ba ni /üîΩsems kun tu dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa la chags pa dang bral ba ni / sems kun tu dag pa'o //
translated: It becomes completely free of attachment to acquiring robes and so on.

original: phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa bsnyen bkur la chags pa dang bral ba ni /üîΩrnam par dkar ba'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa bsnyen bkur la chags pa dang bral ba ni / rnam par dkar ba'o //
translated: It becomes completely free of attachment to being served by others through prostrations and so on.

original: sdod pa la chags shing kha gsag med pa ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: sdod pa la chags shing kha gsag med pa ni skyon med pa'o //
translated: It becomes completely free of attachment to staying in one place and of flattery.

original: sred pa spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It becomes completely free of craving.

original: lta ba spangs pa ni 'jam por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba spangs pa ni 'jam por gyur pa'o //
translated: It becomes completely free of views.

original: the tshom spangs pa ni las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom spangs pa ni las su rung ba'o //
translated: It becomes completely serviceable, free of doubt.

original: phyis nyams pa med pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyis nyams pa med pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: It becomes completely stable, free of backsliding.

original: bsam gtan bzhi mi g-yo ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi mi g-yo ba thob pa'o //
translated: It becomes completely unshakable, having attained the four meditative concentrations.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pas sems shin tu dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pas sems shin tu dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by possessing right view, the mind becomes very pure.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang ldan pas rnam par dkar bar gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang ldan pas rnam par dkar bar gyur te /
translated: By possessing right thought, it becomes very bright,

original: bkur sti la sogs pa la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkur sti la sogs pa la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not think of honor and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang ldan pas skyon med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang ldan pas skyon med par 'gyur te /
translated: By possessing right speech, it becomes faultless,

original: kha gsag la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: kha gsag la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because one is free from flattery and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang ldan pas /
translated: By possessing right action,

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur te /

original: dge ba bsgrub cing nyon mongs pa spong bar brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba bsgrub cing nyon mongs pa spong bar brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one strives to accomplish the wholesome and eliminate the afflictions.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ldan pas 'jam por gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ldan pas 'jam por gyur te /

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing phyin ci log gi 'tsho ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing phyin ci log gi 'tsho ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abides in right view and abandons livelihood based on wrong views.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas las su rung bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas las su rung bar byed do //
translated: By right effort, it becomes serviceable,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal spangs nas sems skyon med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal spangs nas sems skyon med par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ldan pas gnas par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ldan pas gnas par byed de /
translated: He is endowed with right mindfulness and abides in it.

original: the tshom spangs nas mi g-yo bar 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom spangs nas mi g-yo bar 'jog pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas mi g-yo ba thob par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas mi g-yo ba thob par byed de /
translated: He is endowed with right concentration and attains immobility.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi'i sa mngon sum du len par byed phya'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'di dag rim pa 'di ltar bkod /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'di dag rim pa 'di ltar bkod /

original: smras pa / dang por mi rtag pa la sogs par yang dag par mthong nas /
analyzed: smras pa / dang por mi rtag pa la sogs par yang dag par mthong nas /
translated: It is said: First, having seen correctly impermanence, etc.

analyzed: de ni 'di dang 'di lta bu'o zhes de'i 'og tu yang dag par rtogs so //
translated: Then, ‚ÄúIt is like this and like this,‚Äù he understands correctly.

original: yang @81b dag par brtags nas /
analyzed: yang @81b dag par brtags nas /

analyzed: de ltar yang dag par tshig tu phyung nas /

analyzed: ji ltar tshig tu smras pa rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do //

original: yang dag pa'i las bsgrub pa rnams la log pa'i 'tsho ba med pas de'i 'og tu yang dag par 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las bsgrub pa rnams la log pa'i 'tsho ba med pas de'i 'og tu yang dag par 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Since those who practice right action do not have wrong livelihood, right livelihood comes next.

original: yang dag par 'tsho ba rnams la mi dge ba spang ba dang dge ba bsgrub pa'i las 'ba' zhig 'byung bas yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'tsho ba rnams la mi dge ba spang ba dang dge ba bsgrub pa'i las 'ba' zhig 'byung bas yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: Since only the actions of abandoning nonvirtue and accomplishing virtue occur for those who have right livelihood, right effort comes next.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa rnams la nyon mongs pas 'phrog pa'i dran pa mi 'byung bas yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba la gnas pa rnams la nyon mongs pas 'phrog pa'i dran pa mi 'byung bas yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: Since the mindfulness that is carried away by the afflictions does not occur for those who have right effort, right mindfulness comes next.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur te /
translated: One is not under the power of the afflictions.

original: dran pa ma nyams na rtag tu sems rtse gcig tu gnas par gyur pas mjug tu yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dran pa ma nyams na rtag tu sems rtse gcig tu gnas par gyur pas mjug tu yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: When mindfulness does not deteriorate, the mind always abides in one-pointed concentration, and thus right concentration comes last.

original: de'i phyir rim pa de ltar bkod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rim pa de ltar bkod do //
translated: Therefore they are arranged in this order.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa'i lam du bshad la /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa'i lam du bshad la /
translated: According to the Mahayana, the eightfold noble path is explained as the path of meditation.

original: nyan thos bee bh'a shi ka pa'i lta bas ni /
analyzed: nyan thos bee bh'a shi ka pa'i lta bas ni /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika ≈õrƒÅvakas assert that

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po 'di dag mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bor 'dod do //
translated: these eight branches of the ƒÅrya path are the entity of the path of seeing.

analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po 'di dag mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because these eight branches of the ƒÅrya path are the entity of the path of seeing,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called the wheel of dharma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khor lo rin po che dang dpe 'dra ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che dang dpe 'dra ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //

original: ji ltar 'khor lo rin po che dang dpe 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor lo rin po che dang dpe 'dra zhe na /
translated: How is it similar to the example of the precious wheel?

original: 'di ltar mgyogs par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mgyogs par 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is like this: it moves quickly,

original: gtong zhing 'jug pa dang / ma rgyal ba rgyal bar byed pa dang / rgyal bar gnas 'cha' ba dang / yar 'phar zhing mar ltung bas so //
analyzed: gtong zhing 'jug pa dang / ma rgyal ba rgyal bar byed pa dang / rgyal bar gnas 'cha' ba dang / yar 'phar zhing mar ltung bas so //
translated: it goes and enters, it conquers the unconquered, it remains in the conquered, and it rises up and falls down.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor lo rin po che mgyogs par 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor lo rin po che mgyogs par 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the precious wheel of a wheel-turning king moves quickly,

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga lnga la bden pa bzhi rtogs pas na mgyogs par 'gro ba'o //üîΩskad cig ma bco lnga ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / sdug @82a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga lnga la bden pa bzhi rtogs pas na mgyogs par 'gro ba'o // skad cig ma bco lnga ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / sdug @82a * //
translated: It is swift because it realizes the four noble truths in fifteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: The fifteen moments are: the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the origin, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the origin, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin,

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: the subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation,üîΩthe subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path, and the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste de ltar bco lnga'o //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i ye shes dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste de ltar bco lnga'o //
translated: The knowledge of the truth of the path, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, and the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du gtogs pas /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du gtogs pas /
translated: The sixteenth moment, the knowledge of the truth of the path, is included in the path of meditation.

original: mthong ba'i lam du mi gzhag go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du mi gzhag go //
translated: Therefore it is not posited as the path of seeing.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par mthong ba ni /
translated: With regard to that, seeing the truth of suffering of the desire realm as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless is

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: called ‚Äúthe perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering.‚Äù

original: de ltar mthong ba'i tshe 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bcu spong ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i tshe 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bcu spong ste /
translated: When one sees in that way, one abandons the ten types of afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering of the desire realm.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba log pa dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /üîΩnga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba log pa dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa snyems pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
translated: The ten proclivities are: the view of the transitory collection, extreme views, wrong views, esteeming views, esteeming morality and asceticism, doubt, desire, hatred, pride and ignorance.

original: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa spangs bar shes pa dang / phyis rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi skye bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa spangs bar shes pa dang / phyis rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi skye bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom that is the knowledge of the abandonment of the afflictions and the prevention of their future arising is called the wisdom that is the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: dper na mi gnyis kyi gcig gis khyim nas rkun po bzung ste phyung la /
analyzed: dper na mi gnyis kyi gcig gis khyim nas rkun po bzung ste phyung la /
translated: For example, it is like two people: one catches a thief in the house and throws him out,

original: gcig gis sgo bcad pa dang 'dra'o //üîΩde yang gcig gis rkun po bzung nas rkun po dang bcas te /
analyzed: gcig gis sgo bcad pa dang 'dra'o // de yang gcig gis rkun po bzung nas rkun po dang bcas te /
translated: and the other closes the door.

original: sgor phyung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sgor phyung ba bzhin du /
translated: Also, it is like one person catching a thief and throwing him out with the thief,üîΩand

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas kyang nyon mongs pa bcu bzung nas kyang @82b nyon mongs pa dang bcas te 'gag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas kyang nyon mongs pa bcu bzung nas kyang @82b nyon mongs pa dang bcas te 'gag go //
translated: Also, the perseverance for knowing the dharma with regard to suffering seizes the ten afflictions and they cease together with the afflictions.

original: de nas phyis mi gnyis pos phyis rkun po mi 'jug par sgo bcad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas phyis mi gnyis pos phyis rkun po mi 'jug par sgo bcad pa bzhin du /
translated: Then, later, the two men close the door so that the thief does not enter again.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ye shes kyis ni phyis sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi skye bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i ye shes kyis ni phyis sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi skye bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, the transcendent wisdom that is the perseverance for knowing the dharma with regard to suffering prevents the arising of afflictions in the mindstream later.

original: de la bzod pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, perseverance is called the uninterrupted path.

original: ye shes la ni rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes la ni rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: And transcendent wisdom is called the path of liberation.

original: dper na mi gnyis kyis rkun ma skrod pa'i tshul 'di ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na mi gnyis kyis rkun ma skrod pa'i tshul 'di ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa yang sbyar ro //
translated: This example of two men expelling a thief is also applied to the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir bkod pa yang log pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir bkod pa yang log pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The four aspects such as impermanence are also antidotes to the four kinds of false yogis.

original: bzhi ni 'dod chags la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis dang lta ba la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bzhi ni 'dod chags la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis dang lta ba la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The four are the two who practice desire and the two who practice views.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis ni nga'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa dang / le lo la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis ni nga'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa dang / le lo la chags pa'o //
translated: The two who practice desire are those who are overcome by the pride of ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and those who are attached to laziness.

original: lta ba la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la spyod pa rnam pa gnyis ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: The two who practice views are those who are attached to grasping ‚ÄúI‚Äù and grasping ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de la nga'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa ni mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes bsnyems shing spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la nga'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal gyis non pa ni mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes bsnyems shing spyod pa ste /
translated: Among them, those who are overcome by the pride of ‚ÄúI am‚Äù are those who are proud and practice ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù in relation to the impermanent.

original: de'i gnyen por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag par bshad de /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag par bshad de /
translated: The antidote to that is the explanation of impermanence in the truth of suffering.

original: phung po lnga ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five aggregates have the nature of being momentary.

original: de la bden par 'dzin cing chags pa de spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bden par 'dzin cing chags pa de spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the grasping and attachment to that as real,

original: dge ba mi byed pa'i phyir gnyen por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sdug bsngal du bshad de /
analyzed: dge ba mi byed pa'i phyir gnyen por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sdug bsngal du bshad de /
translated: the antidote is the explanation of suffering in the truth of suffering because virtue is not performed.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all formations are associated with the three types of suffering.

original: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por bdag med par bshad de /
analyzed: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por bdag med par bshad de /

analyzed: @86b dper na nyin mo goms pa'i rmi lam du mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like seeing in a dream what one has seen during the day.

original: mtshan mar mthong ba ni chos 'dra dang mi 'dra ba mthong ba las dran pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar mthong ba ni chos 'dra dang mi 'dra ba mthong ba las dran pa 'byung ste /

original: dper na bu dang 'dra ba mthong nas bu dran pa dang / lhags pas nyen nas me dran pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bu dang 'dra ba mthong nas bu dran pa dang / lhags pas nyen nas me dran pa'o //
translated: For example, having seen someone who resembles one's son, one remembers one's son; or, being afflicted by cold, one remembers fire.

original: yid dang ba ni chu gsal bar bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: yid dang ba ni chu gsal bar bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: When the mind is clear, like a clear reflection in water,

original: sems gsal te sgrib pa'i shas chung na sngon ci byas pa rnams dran no //
analyzed: sems gsal te sgrib pa'i shas chung na sngon ci byas pa rnams dran no //
translated: if the mind is clear and has little obscuration, one remembers what one has done before.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is called right concentration?

original: yang dag pa ni drang po la bya la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni drang po la bya la /
translated: Right means straight.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gyur pa'am 'dzin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gyur pa'am 'dzin pa la bya ste /
translated: It is called concentration because it is the transformation or grasping of concentration.

original: dper na sbrul smyug ma'i sbubs su bcug na drang por 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sbrul smyug ma'i sbubs su bcug na drang por 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, when a snake is put into a bamboo tube, it becomes straight.

original: sems rmugs pa dang / rgod pa la sogs pa las bzlog nas drang por 'dzin pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rmugs pa dang / rgod pa la sogs pa las bzlog nas drang por 'dzin pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Similarly, having turned away from dullness, agitation, and so on, holding the mind straight is right concentration.

original: yang na yang dag pa ni mnyam pa la bya la /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa ni mnyam pa la bya la /
translated: Or else, correct is taken as evenness,

original: ting nge 'dzin ni 'jog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni 'jog pa la bya ste /
translated: and concentration is taken as placement.

original: sems mnyam par 'jog pa ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems mnyam par 'jog pa ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Even placement of the mind is correct concentration.

original: de la lam gyi yan lag mdo tsam du gsungs pa rgyas par bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lam gyi yan lag mdo tsam du gsungs pa rgyas par bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain in detail the branches of the path that were taught in brief,

original: dge slong dag yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dge slong dag yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //
translated: the Buddha said, ‚ÄúMonks, what is right view?

original: ci'i phyir mdo tsam du bshad nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo tsam du bshad nas /
translated: Why did he teach in brief and then

original: rgyas par bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: rgyas par bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: explain in detail?

original: 'dul ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of disciples:

original: glengs pas shes pa dang / spros pas shes pa'o //üîΩde la glengs pas shes pa rnams kyi ched du ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: glengs pas shes pa dang / spros pas shes pa'o // de la glengs pas shes pa rnams kyi ched du ni 'di lta ste /
translated: those who understand through a brief teaching and those who understand through an extensive teaching.üîΩFor the sake of those who understand through a brief teaching, he taught in brief, saying, ‚ÄúMonks, what is right view?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo tsam du gsungs nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo tsam du gsungs nas /
translated: and so on.

original: spros pas shes pa rnams rgya cher ma bshad pa na don rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pas shes pa rnams rgya cher ma bshad pa na don rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: But when he did not explain in detail for the sake of those who understand through an extensive teaching, they were unable to understand the meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos la slob dpon 'chab pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos la slob dpon 'chab pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: The Tathagata, the teacher of the Dharma, is not secretive.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas de la dge slong dag yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bka' stsal to //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas de la dge slong dag yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bka' stsal to //
translated: Endowed with great compassion, he has extensively taught the bhikshus, saying, ‚ÄúWhat is right view?‚Äù and so on.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Right view is of three kinds:

original: slob ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: slob ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: the right view of the trainee, the right view of the non-trainee, and the right view of the worldling.

original: de slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa na lta @87a * //
analyzed: de slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa na lta @87a * //
translated: When the trainee and non-trainee persons enter meditative equipoise,

original: ba gang yin pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩting nge 'dzin las langs nas lta ba ni rtogs pa dang bcas pa yin pas /
analyzed: ba gang yin pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o // ting nge 'dzin las langs nas lta ba ni rtogs pa dang bcas pa yin pas /
translated: the view is called the right view of the trainee and the right view of the non-trainee.üîΩWhen they rise from samadhi and view,

original: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is accompanied by conceptualization, so it is called the right view of the worldling.

original: yang na gang zag dge ba rnams tshe rabs gzhan yod par lta zhing /
analyzed: yang na gang zag dge ba rnams tshe rabs gzhan yod par lta zhing /
translated: Or, when virtuous persons view the existence of other lives,

original: las dang las kyi 'bras bu la skur pa mi 'debs pa ni /üîΩ'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: las dang las kyi 'bras bu la skur pa mi 'debs pa ni / 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The correct view of the world is not to deny karma and its results.

original: 'dir ni 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba ston par byed par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la chos drug yod par lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba ston par byed par rig par bya'o // de la chos drug yod par lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Here, the correct view of the world should be understood as teaching the existence of the six dharmas.

original: 'jug pa'i rten yod par lta ba dang / de'i rkyen gyi sa bon dang / gzhi yod par lta ba dang sbyin pa'i yon tan yod par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par lta ba dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten yod par lta ba dang / de'i rkyen gyi sa bon dang / gzhi yod par lta ba dang sbyin pa'i yon tan yod par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par lta ba dang /
translated: The correct view is the view that the six dharmas exist: the view that the basis of engagement exists, the view that the seed of its condition exists, the view that the basis exists, the view that the qualities of generosity exist, the view that the antidotes of generosity, morality, and meditation exist, and the view that the opposing factors exist.

original: de gsum mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i 'bras bu yod par lta ba dang / 'jug pa las rnam par log par lta ba dang drug go //üîΩde la 'jig rten 'di yod 'jig rten pha rol yod /
analyzed: de gsum mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i 'bras bu yod par lta ba dang / 'jug pa las rnam par log par lta ba dang drug go // de la 'jig rten 'di yod 'jig rten pha rol yod /
translated: The view that the three‚Äîthe opposing factors, the antidotes, and the results‚Äîexist, and the view that turning away from engagement exists.

original: ces bya bas 'jug pa'i rten yod pa lta ba bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas 'jug pa'i rten yod pa lta ba bstan te /
translated: Here, the view that this world exists and the world beyond exists teaches the view that the basis of engagement exists.

original: tshe gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'i rten ni 'jug rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol yin la /
analyzed: tshe gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'i rten ni 'jug rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol yin la /
translated: The basis for the transition from one life to another is this life and the next life.üîΩThe assertion that this life is the five aggregates with karma and afflictions and that the aggregates in other lives are due to the cause of karma and afflictions in this life is called

original: tshe 'di yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga yod par 'dod cing tshe 'di'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du yang phung po len par 'dod pa ni 'jig rten 'di yod pa dang 'jig rten pha rol yod par ltaüîΩba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga yod par 'dod cing tshe 'di'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du yang phung po len par 'dod pa ni 'jig rten 'di yod pa dang 'jig rten pha rol yod par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the view that this world exists and the next world exists.

original: ma yod pa dang pha yod pa zhes bya bas de'i rkyen gyis sa bon dang bzhi yod par bstan to /
analyzed: ma yod pa dang pha yod pa zhes bya bas de'i rkyen gyis sa bon dang bzhi yod par bstan to /
translated: The existence of the mother and the existence of the father indicate the existence of the four conditions.

original: phung po lnga skye ba'i sa bon 'jog pa ni pha yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga skye ba'i sa bon 'jog pa ni pha yin no //
translated: The father is the one who deposits the seed that is the cause of the five aggregates.

original: sa bon gyi rten byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rten byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mother is the one who provides the support for the seed.

original: de gnyis kyang yod par lta ba ni ma yod pa dang / pha yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang yod par lta ba ni ma yod pa dang / pha yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The view that both of them exist is called the view that the mother exists and the view that the father exists.

original: sbyin pa yod pa dang / sbyin sreg yod pa zhes bya bas sbyin pa dang / lha la mchod pa yod par lta ba bstan te /
analyzed: sbyin pa yod pa dang / sbyin sreg yod pa zhes bya bas sbyin pa dang / lha la mchod pa yod par lta ba bstan te /
translated: The view that giving and sacrifice exist is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe view that giving and sacrifice exist.‚ÄùüîΩThe view that there are sentient beings who receive gifts when one gives gifts and the view that there are gods who receive sacrifices when one performs sacrifices is called the view that giving and sacrifice exist.

original: yo byad rnams byin na de len par byed pa'i sems can yod par lta ba dang / sbyin sreg byas na de na sbyin sreg len pa'i lha len par lta ba ni sbyin pa yod pa dang / sbyin sreg yod par @87b lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩ'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa zhes bya bas /üîΩsbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par lta ba bstan te /üîΩsbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dge ba'i phyogs gnyen por gyur pa la ni 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad rnams byin na de len par byed pa'i sems can yod par lta ba dang / sbyin sreg byas na de na sbyin sreg len pa'i lha len par lta ba ni sbyin pa yod pa dang / sbyin sreg yod par @87b lta ba zhes bya'o // 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa zhes bya bas / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par lta ba bstan te / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dge ba'i phyogs gnyen por gyur pa la ni 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The view that the adverse and the favorable exist is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe view that the adverse and the favorable exist.‚ÄùüîΩThe adverse and the favorable are the adverse and the favorable of the three: giving, morality, and meditation.üîΩThe adverse of giving is stinginess, the adverse of morality is immorality, and the adverse of meditation is distraction.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang ngang tshul ngan pa dang / sems g-yengs pa mi dge ba'i phyogs su gyur pa ni mi 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang ngang tshul ngan pa dang / sems g-yengs pa mi dge ba'i phyogs su gyur pa ni mi 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The favorable of giving is the virtuous side that is the antidote to stinginess, the favorable of morality is the virtuous side that is the antidote to immorality, and the favorable of meditation is the virtuous side that is the antidote to distraction.

original: yang na bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi las dge ba ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi las dge ba ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Or else, virtuous karma, which is characterized as meritorious and invariable, is desirable.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las mi dge ba ni mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las mi dge ba ni mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous karma, which is characterized as demeritorious, is undesirable.

original: de dag yod par lta ba ni /
analyzed: de dag yod par lta ba ni /
translated: The view that these exist is

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa yod par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa yod par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the view that desirable and undesirable things exist.üîΩThe view that the results of good and bad karma exist and that the results of karma are not lost even after a long time

original: legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod pa dang zhes bya bas de gsum gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i 'bras bu yod par lta ba bstan te /
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod pa dang zhes bya bas de gsum gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i 'bras bu yod par lta ba bstan te /
translated: demonstrates the view that the results of counteragents and antidotes exist.

original: sbyin pa byas na longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims bsrungs na mtho ris su skye ba dang / tshad med pa bsgoms na mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar lta ba dang / ser sna byas na dbul por 'gyur pa dang ;
analyzed: sbyin pa byas na longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims bsrungs na mtho ris su skye ba dang / tshad med pa bsgoms na mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar lta ba dang / ser sna byas na dbul por 'gyur pa dang ;
translated: The view that giving results in great wealth, that observing ethical discipline results in rebirth in the higher realms, and that cultivating the immeasurables results in nirvana, and the view that stinginess results in poverty,

original: tshul khrims dral na ngan song du skye ba dang / tshad med pa ma bsgoms na thar par mi 'gyur ro zhes lta ba'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims dral na ngan song du skye ba dang / tshad med pa ma bsgoms na thar par mi 'gyur ro zhes lta ba'am /
translated: The view that if one violates morality, one is reborn in the miserable realms, and if one does not cultivate the immeasurables, one will not attain liberation,

original: bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i las byas na bde 'gror skye ba dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las byas na ngan song gsum du skye bar lta ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i las byas na bde 'gror skye ba dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las byas na ngan song gsum du skye bar lta ba ni /
translated: The view that if one performs meritorious and unshakable karma, one is reborn in the happy realms, and if one performs non-meritorious karma, one is reborn in the three miserable realms,

original: las legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the view that the results of good and bad karma exist.

original: 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa yod ces bya bas 'jug pa las rnam par log par yod par lta ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa yod ces bya bas 'jug pa las rnam par log par yod par lta ba bstan te /
translated: The statement in the world, there are those who have gone rightly and those who have entered rightly teaches the view that there is an agent that is separate from engagement.

original: 'jug pa ni 'khor bar skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'khor bar skye ba'o //
translated: Engagement is rebirth in cyclic existence.

original: 'khor bar skye ba la log pa ni 'phags pa rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te de dag yod par lta ba ni 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa yod par lta ba zhes @88a * //
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba la log pa ni 'phags pa rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te de dag yod par lta ba ni 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa yod par lta ba zhes @88a * //
translated: The view that they exist is called the view that the one who has gone rightly and the one who has entered rightly exist.

original: bya'o // de la rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa ni yang dag par song ba'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de la rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa ni yang dag par song ba'o //
translated: Among them, the noble ones, such as the stream-enterers, are the ones who have gone rightly.

original: de las bzlog pa 'di ni log pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa 'di ni log pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is called wrong view.

original: zhes bya ba la yang dag pa'i lta ba las bzlog pa ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la yang dag pa'i lta ba las bzlog pa ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The opposite of right view is wrong view.

original: 'jig rten 'di med /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med /
translated: One views that this world does not exist,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med ces bya ba la sogs par lta'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med ces bya ba la sogs par lta'o //
translated: that the other world does not exist, and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain right thought,

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is right thought?

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba la sogs par bsngo ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba la sogs par bsngo ste /
translated: It is the dedication of generosity and morality to Buddhahood, etc.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs par ma bsngos pa 'di yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o zhes gsungs so //üîΩdon du na mi dge ba la sogs par rtog pa'i gnyen por sems dge bar rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs par ma bsngos pa 'di yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o zhes gsungs so // don du na mi dge ba la sogs par rtog pa'i gnyen por sems dge bar rtogs pa ni /
translated: This is right thought.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa'o //üîΩde la sbyin pa gang kha na ma tho ba med pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa'o // de la sbyin pa gang kha na ma tho ba med pa /

translated: No, it was not, but it was not appropriate for the people of the city to sing songs that were composed by people of the city, for the purpose of attaining nirvana, which is the escape from cyclic existence. Since they were not composed by people of the city, there was no fault.

original: yan lag bzhi dang ldan na tshig kyal par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi dang ldan na tshig kyal par smra ba yin te /
translated: If one has four limbs, one speaks idle speech.

original: yan lag bzhi ni chags pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / tshig kyal par smra bar bsam pa dang / tshig kyal par smras pa dang / gzhan dag gis kyang thos te chags pa skyes so //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni chags pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / tshig kyal par smra bar bsam pa dang / tshig kyal par smras pa dang / gzhan dag gis kyang thos te chags pa skyes so //
translated: The four limbs are: having a desirous thought, thinking to speak idle speech, speaking idle speech, and others hearing it and desire arises.

original: ngag gi las rgyas par bshad pa bsdu ba'i phyir 'di ni ngag gi rnam pa bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ngag gi las rgyas par bshad pa bsdu ba'i phyir 'di ni ngag gi rnam pa bzhi'o // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to summarize the extensive explanation of verbal karma, it says: These are the four types of speech.

original: chags sems bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chags sems bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach covetousness, it says:

original: de la chags pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la chags pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is covetousness?

original: gang gzhan gyi nor de rnams bdag gir gyur cig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi nor de rnams bdag gir gyur cig ces bya ba la /
translated: It is thinking, May the wealth of others become mine.

original: gang sems can gzhan gyi @95b nor 'bru'i dngos po dang / gter gyi dngos po dang / yul gyi dngos po rnams la chags pas de dag ji ltar bdag gir gyur par bya zhes bsams te /
analyzed: gang sems can gzhan gyi @95b nor 'bru'i dngos po dang / gter gyi dngos po dang / yul gyi dngos po rnams la chags pas de dag ji ltar bdag gir gyur par bya zhes bsams te /
translated: With regard to the wealth, grain, treasures, and lands of other sentient beings, through covetousness one thinks, How can I make them mine?

original: gzhan gyi nor la mthu dang 'jab bu la sogs pas brkus nas bdag gir byed par 'dod pa ni chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor la mthu dang 'jab bu la sogs pas brkus nas bdag gir byed par 'dod pa ni chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire to make another's property one's own by force, stealth, etc., is called covetousness.

original: yan lag gsum dang ldan na chags sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag gsum dang ldan na chags sems su 'gyur te /
translated: When one has three members, there is covetousness.

original: chags pa'i bsam pa yang yod /
analyzed: chags pa'i bsam pa yang yod /
translated: There is the thought of covetousness,

original: nor la brku bar yang sems /
analyzed: nor la brku bar yang sems /
translated: and there is the thought of stealing another's property,

original: brku bar bya ba'i sbyor ba yang rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i sbyor ba yang rtsom pa'o //
translated: and there is the preparation for stealing.

original: gnod sems bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod sems bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate malice, he said,

original: de la gnod sems gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la gnod sems gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is malice? and so on.

original: zhe sdang gi sems kyis gzhan gyi 'tsho ba dang dbral bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems kyis gzhan gyi 'tsho ba dang dbral bar bya ba'am /
translated: The thought of harming another with a hostile mind,

original: lus la gnod par bya ba sems pa ni gnod sems so //
analyzed: lus la gnod par bya ba sems pa ni gnod sems so //
translated: or the thought of harming the body, is malice.

original: de gnyis kyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩpha rol 'tsho ba dang dbral ba zhes bya ga gsungs te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir / pha rol 'tsho ba dang dbral ba zhes bya ga gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of those two,üîΩhe said, The deprivation of another's livelihood.

original: 'tsho ba dang dbral bar sems pa ni gzhan dag gsad par sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang dbral bar sems pa ni gzhan dag gsad par sems pa'o //
translated: The thought of depriving livelihood is the thought of killing others.

original: bcad pa ni mtshon cha la sogs pas yan lag gtubs par sems pa'am /üîΩnor la sogs pa dang dbral bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: bcad pa ni mtshon cha la sogs pas yan lag gtubs par sems pa'am / nor la sogs pa dang dbral bar sems pa'o //
translated: Cutting is thinking of cutting off the limbs with a weapon, etc., or thinking of separating from wealth, etc.

original: gzir ba ni bcings pa dang brdeg pa la sogs par sems pa'o //
analyzed: gzir ba ni bcings pa dang brdeg pa la sogs par sems pa'o //
translated: Oppressing is thinking of binding, beating, etc.

original: yan lag gsum dang ldan na gnod sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag gsum dang ldan na gnod sems su 'gyur te /
translated: When one has the three limbs, there is malice.

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gnod par bya bar sems pa dang / gnod par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba la rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gnod par bya bar sems pa dang / gnod par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba la rtsom pa'o //
translated: It is when one has hatred, thinks of harming, and begins the application for the sake of harming.

original: log pa'i lta ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach wrong views, it is said:

original: de la log pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la log pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is wrong view? and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba las bzlog pa ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba las bzlog pa ni log pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Wrong view is the opposite of right view.

original: de yang 'jig rten 'di med /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'di med /
translated: It is saying that this world does not exist,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med ces bya ba la sogs pa gong ma las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med ces bya ba la sogs pa gong ma las bzlog pa'o //
translated: the other world does not exist, and so on, the opposite of the above.

original: log pa'i lta bas chos lnga la skur pa 'debs te ;
analyzed: log pa'i lta bas chos lnga la skur pa 'debs te ;
translated: By wrong view, one denies the five dharmas:

original: 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba la skur ba 'debs pa dang / sa bon 'jog pa dang gzhi la skur pa 'debs pa dang / rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / dam pa'i dngos po chud za bar byed pa'o //üîΩde la @96a * //üîΩ'jig rten 'di med 'jig rten pha rol med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba la skur ba 'debs pa dang / sa bon 'jog pa dang gzhi la skur pa 'debs pa dang / rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / dam pa'i dngos po chud za bar byed pa'o // de la @96a * // 'jig rten 'di med 'jig rten pha rol med ces bya ba ni /
translated: Denial of effect is the denial of the effect of the seed.üîΩDenial of the holy is the denial of the holy life.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Denial of the other world is the denial of going to the other world and not going to the other world.

original: ma med pha med ces bya ba ni sa bon dang gzhi'i bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa'o //üîΩsbyin pa med sbyin sreg med /
analyzed: ma med pha med ces bya ba ni sa bon dang gzhi'i bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa'o // sbyin pa med sbyin sreg med /
translated: Denial of seed and ground is the denial of the activity of seed and ground.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa med ces bya ba ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa med ces bya ba ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Denial of cause is the denial of the cause of the seed.üîΩDenial of effect is the denial of the effect of the seed.

original: legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med ces bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med ces bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Denial of the holy is the denial of the holy life.

original: 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa med ces bya ba ni dam pa'i dngos po chud za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa med ces bya ba ni dam pa'i dngos po chud za bar byed pa'o //
translated: The statement there is no one in the world who is truly righteous or who practices righteously is the wasting away of the true goods.

original: yan lag gsum dang ldan na log pa'i lta ba yin te /
analyzed: yan lag gsum dang ldan na log pa'i lta ba yin te /
translated: When one possesses three limbs, one has wrong views:

original: gti mug dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems yid ches pa dang / de bzhin du yang tshig tu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems yid ches pa dang / de bzhin du yang tshig tu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: when one possesses delusion, when one's mind is convinced that there is no afterlife, etc., and when one expresses that view.üîΩThe classification of the ten unwholesome courses of action is as follows:

original: rab tu dbye ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste /
translated: They are established as fourfold:

original: dngos po dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mthar thug pa'o //
translated: 1. basis, 2. intention, 3. performance, and 4. culmination.

original: de la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi dngos po ni dngos po gang la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ste /üîΩde yang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi dngos po ni dngos po gang la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ste / de yang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: The basis of the ten unwholesome courses of action is the basis on which killing, etc., occur.üîΩThat is twofold:üîΩ1. that which is included in the category of sentient beings and

original: rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: 2. that which is included in the category of non-sentient beings.

original: bsam pa ni dngos po de yin par shes pa dang / de'i las bya bar 'dod pa'i sems skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni dngos po de yin par shes pa dang / de'i las bya bar 'dod pa'i sems skyes pa'o //
translated: The intention is the recognition of the object and the arising of the thought that wishes to commit the action.

original: sbyor ba ni de'i las bya ba'i phyir bdag gam gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas rtsom pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de'i las bya ba'i phyir bdag gam gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas rtsom pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: The performance is the engagement in the action through the body, speech, or mind of oneself or another for the sake of that action.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni sbyor ba de dag de las de dag gis de'i dus na mthar phyin par byas pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni sbyor ba de dag de las de dag gis de'i dus na mthar phyin par byas pa'am /
translated: The completion is the bringing of those preparations to an end at that time by means of those actions, or

original: phyis mthar phyin par byas pa'o //
analyzed: phyis mthar phyin par byas pa'o //
translated: the bringing of them to an end later.

original: de la srog gcod pa'i dngos po ni mi dang phyugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa'i dngos po ni mi dang phyugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: With regard to killing, the object is a sentient being, such as a human or an animal.

original: bsam pa ni sems can yin pa yang shes la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni sems can yin pa yang shes la /
translated: The intention is the recognition of the sentient being

original: de bsad pa yang bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de bsad pa yang bsam pa'o //
translated: and the thought to kill it.

original: sbyor ba ni de la 'ga' zhig phyugs bsad par 'dod nas khri las ldang / rin blangs /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de la 'ga' zhig phyugs bsad par 'dod nas khri las ldang / rin blangs /
translated: The performance is, for example, if one wishes to kill an animal, one gets up from one‚Äôs seat, takes the price,

original: lam du zhugs /
analyzed: lam du zhugs /
translated: sets out on the road,

original: bsnams @96b khrid bran khrims bcug /
analyzed: bsnams @96b khrid bran khrims bcug /
translated: leads the animal, ties it up,

original: mtshon gyis bsnun te /
analyzed: mtshon gyis bsnun te /
translated: and strikes it with a weapon.

original: mtshon gcig gnyis la sogs pa ji srid du 'tsho ba dang bral bar ma gyur gyi bar gyi las byed pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mtshon gcig gnyis la sogs pa ji srid du 'tsho ba dang bral bar ma gyur gyi bar gyi las byed pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The performance is the action of killing by means of one or two weapons, etc., until the life is extinguished.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni srog chags de sbyor ba des de'i tshe shi ba'am /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni srog chags de sbyor ba des de'i tshe shi ba'am /
translated: The completion is the death of the living being at that time by that performance,

original: phyis shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyis shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: or the death later.

original: ma byin par len pa'i dngos po ni mi dang phyugs la sogs pa'i sems can gyi dngos po'am /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i dngos po ni mi dang phyugs la sogs pa'i sems can gyi dngos po'am /
translated: The object of taking what is not given is the object of a living being, such as a human or an animal,

original: 'bru dang gter la sogs pa'i sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'bru dang gter la sogs pa'i sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: or the object of a non-living being, such as grain, treasure, etc.

original: bsam pa de ni dngos po de kun yin par shes la /
analyzed: bsam pa de ni dngos po de kun yin par shes la /
translated: The intention is the recognition of that object,

original: gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: and the desire to make one's own the object that belongs to another.

original: sbyor ba ni khri las ldang ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni khri las ldang ngo //
translated: The performance is rising from one's seat,

original: lam du 'jug go //
analyzed: lam du 'jug go //
translated: entering the road,

original: khyim 'bigs pa la sogs pa byed pa nas /
analyzed: khyim 'bigs pa la sogs pa byed pa nas /
translated: digging a hole in the ground, etc.,

original: ji ltar ji srid du dngos po ma blangs kyi bar gyi las byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ji srid du dngos po ma blangs kyi bar gyi las byed pa'o //
translated: up to the action of taking the object, as long as it is not taken.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni mthu'am /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni mthu'am /
translated: The completion is by force,üîΩor by stealth.

original: 'jab bus dngos po de dag bdag gir byas pa'o //üîΩ'dod pas log par spyod pa'i dngos po ni 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jab bus dngos po de dag bdag gir byas pa'o // 'dod pas log par spyod pa'i dngos po ni 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: One appropriates those things by stealth.

original: bsam pa ni bud med la sogs pa yin par yang shes la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni bud med la sogs pa yin par yang shes la /
translated: The basis of sexual misconduct is a woman or a neuter who is used by another, and so on.

original: de la kun tu spyad par bya bar 'dod pa skyes pa'o //üîΩsbyor ba ni kun tu spyad par bya ba'i phyir stan las langs nas bud med kyi gnas su phyin te /
analyzed: de la kun tu spyad par bya bar 'dod pa skyes pa'o // sbyor ba ni kun tu spyad par bya ba'i phyir stan las langs nas bud med kyi gnas su phyin te /
translated: The intention is the desire to have intercourse with her.

original: mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'i bar gyi las byed pa'o //
analyzed: mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa la 'dzin pa'i bar gyi las byed pa'o //
translated: The performance is the arising of the desire to have intercourse, rising from one's seat and going to the place of the woman, and so on, up to the holding of her head and hands.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa'o //
translated: The final step is the joining of the two organs.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i dngos po ni mi la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rig pa dang / shes pa dang /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i dngos po ni mi la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rig pa dang / shes pa dang /
translated: The basis of false speech is a human being, and so on, who is included in the number of sentient beings, or grain, and so on, which is not included in the number of sentient beings.üîΩThe intention is the desire to deceive another.üîΩThe performance is the utterance of the words.üîΩThe final step is the understanding of the meaning by the one to whom the words are addressed.

original: ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / ma rig pa dang / ma shes pa'o //üîΩbsam pa ni shes bzhin du gzhan du 'du shes /
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / ma rig pa dang / ma shes pa'o // bsam pa ni shes bzhin du gzhan du 'du shes /
translated: Not seeing, not hearing, not knowing, not understanding.

original: gzhan du smra bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the desire to speak falsely, with a different understanding and a different expression.

original: sbyor ba ni de'i phyir khri las ldang ba dang / lam du 'jug pa dang / smra bar rtsom pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de'i phyir khri las ldang ba dang / lam du 'jug pa dang / smra bar rtsom pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The performance is rising from one‚Äôs seat, going to the place, and beginning to speak.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni dbang gi 'khor tshogs pa'i dbus su brdzun gyi tshigs smras pa'o //üîΩphra ma'i dngos po ni dum pa'i @97a * //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni dbang gi 'khor tshogs pa'i dbus su brdzun gyi tshigs smras pa'o // phra ma'i dngos po ni dum pa'i @97a * //
translated: The completion is speaking the false words in the midst of the assembly of the king‚Äôs court.

original: sems can dang / ma dum pa'i sems can dang / phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: sems can dang / ma dum pa'i sems can dang / phyogs gnyis so //
translated: The basis of slander is a person who is divided, a person who is not divided, and the two sides.

original: de la dum pa ni snga nas mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dum pa ni snga nas mdza' ba'o //
translated: Among them, the divided person is one who was previously friendly.

original: ma dum pa ni bye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma dum pa ni bye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The person who is not divided is one who has become estranged.

original: bsam pa ni de nyid dbye bar bya bar 'dod pa'i sems te /üîΩde yang 'dum pa la mi dga' ba dang / mi 'dum pa la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ni de nyid dbye bar bya bar 'dod pa'i sems te / de yang 'dum pa la mi dga' ba dang / mi 'dum pa la dga' ba ste /
translated: The intention is the thought that desires to divide those two.

original: rnam pa gnyis so /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis so /
translated: Moreover, it is of two kinds: not delighting in reconciliation and delighting in division.üîΩThe performance is the effort to divide them.üîΩThe completion is the effort to divide them.

original: sbyor ba ni de dag dbye bar bya ba'i phyir stan las langs pa la sogs pa'i las rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de dag dbye bar bya ba'i phyir stan las langs pa la sogs pa'i las rtsom pa'o //
translated: The performance is the undertaking of the action of rising from one's seat, etc. in order to divide them.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni tshu rol nas blangs te pha rol du bsnyad pa dang / pha rol du blangs nas tshu rol du bsnyad nas phyogs su dbye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni tshu rol nas blangs te pha rol du bsnyad pa dang / pha rol du blangs nas tshu rol du bsnyad nas phyogs su dbye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The completion is the division of the factions by taking up the side here and reporting it there, and taking up the side there and reporting it here.

original: de la mdza' ba rnams la ni mi mdza' bar bya ba'i phyir dbye ba'i tshig smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la mdza' ba rnams la ni mi mdza' bar bya ba'i phyir dbye ba'i tshig smra ba ste /
translated: In this regard, one speaks divisive words in order to make friends into enemies.

original: mi mdza' ba rnams la phyis kyang mdza' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir tshig gis snon pa'o //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba rnams la phyis kyang mdza' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir tshig gis snon pa'o //
translated: One speaks harsh words in order to make enemies stay enemies, because one does not want to make friends.

original: ngag rtsub po'i dngos po ni zhe sdang gi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can no //
analyzed: ngag rtsub po'i dngos po ni zhe sdang gi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can no //

analyzed: gis byas pa'i las kyi lam rnams la ni 'bring zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi dge ba bcu las shas cher spyad na /

analyzed: gzhan dang 'thab cing rtsod par 'gyur ba'o //
