translated: It is also the case that when other virtuous individuals, who are one's gurus, come, one rises from one's seat, greets them, and offers them a seat.

original: thal mo sbyar ba'i las byed ces bya bas gnas gcig na 'khod pa'i gang zag yon tan can rnams la gus pa'i tshul ston pa ste /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba'i las byed ces bya bas gnas gcig na 'khod pa'i gang zag yon tan can rnams la gus pa'i tshul ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase one performs the action of joining one's palms is stated from the perspective of virtuous individuals who are seated in the same place.

original: gnas gcig na gnas pa'i gang zag tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang phrad na yang lus btud pa dang thal mo sbyar ba'i las byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gcig na gnas pa'i gang zag tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang phrad na yang lus btud pa dang thal mo sbyar ba'i las byed pa ste /
translated: When one meets with fellow practitioners of the holy life in the same place, one bows one‚Äôs body and performs the action of joining one‚Äôs palms.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: This is right effort.

original: mdor na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa la brtson pa ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa la brtson pa ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: In brief, right effort is the exertion to abandon the counteragent and to cultivate the antidote.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain right mindfulness, he said:

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right mindfulness?

original: 'di la dge slong dag ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong dag ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Here a monk dwells contemplating the body in the body, ardent, clearly knowing, and mindful, after removing avarice and sorrow regarding the world.

original: de la sems can rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sems can rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of sentient beings:

original: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin can dang / zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can dang / gti mug gi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin can dang / zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can dang / gti mug gi rang bzhin can no //
translated: those whose nature is desire, those whose nature is hatred, and those whose nature is delusion.

original: gsum po de dag gi mtshan ma brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum po de dag gi mtshan ma brtag par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of those three should be examined.

original: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo zhing g-yengs pa'i ngang tshul can glu dang gar la sogs pa la dga' ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo zhing g-yengs pa'i ngang tshul can glu dang gar la sogs pa la dga' ba /
translated: The signs of one whose nature is passion are: a natural disposition to be fickle and distracted; delight in singing, dancing, and so on;

original: dran pa nyams pa la rtag par sems ngang gis 'jam pa /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa la rtag par sems ngang gis 'jam pa /
translated: forgetfulness; a mind that is naturally smooth;

original: phrag dog che ba /üîΩngo @106b tsha ba mang ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: phrag dog che ba / ngo @106b tsha ba mang ba la gnas pa /
translated: great jealousy;üîΩa disposition to be ashamed;

original: 'dod chags spangs par dka' ba kha na ma tho ba chung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags spangs par dka' ba kha na ma tho ba chung ba'o //
translated: and difficulty in abandoning passion, with little wrongdoing.

original: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ni ci la yang gleng ba dang smra bar byed pa 'thab mo la dga' ba /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ni ci la yang gleng ba dang smra bar byed pa 'thab mo la dga' ba /
translated: The signs of one whose nature is aversion are: talking and arguing about anything; delight in fighting;

original: bzhin khro gnyer can /
analyzed: bzhin khro gnyer can /
translated: a face with a frown;

original: mgu dka' ba /
analyzed: mgu dka' ba /
translated: difficulty in being pleased;

original: sems ngang rtsub po rno ba /
analyzed: sems ngang rtsub po rno ba /
translated: a mind that is naturally rough and sharp;

original: sdig la dga' ba /
analyzed: sdig la dga' ba /
translated: delight in wrongdoing;

original: sems can sems rtsub cing gnod par byed pa la mos pa /
analyzed: sems can sems rtsub cing gnod par byed pa la mos pa /
translated: and a disposition to be cruel and harmful to sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa spang bar bla ba ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang bar bla ba ste //
translated: It is difficult to abandon afflictions,

original: kha na ma tho ba chen po'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba chen po'o //
translated: and there is great wrongdoing.

original: gti mug gi rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: gti mug gi rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of one whose nature is delusion are:

original: yid gnyis can las su bya ba la spros pa med pa /
analyzed: yid gnyis can las su bya ba la spros pa med pa /
translated: He is not indecisive about what he has to do.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa mang ba rtog pa dang sen lcigs can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa /
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa mang ba rtog pa dang sen lcigs can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa /
translated: He is not given to sleep and laziness. He is not of a nature to be given to thoughts and gossip.

original: shing bal dang srin bal lta bu'i sems rmongs pa mang ba le lo che ba su la yang yid mi rton pa skye bo de nyid kyang yid brtan du mi rung ba /
analyzed: shing bal dang srin bal lta bu'i sems rmongs pa mang ba le lo che ba su la yang yid mi rton pa skye bo de nyid kyang yid brtan du mi rung ba /
translated: He is not given to much confusion of mind, like cotton or silk. He is not lazy. He does not trust anyone. He is not a person to be trusted.

original: 'gro ba dge ba rnams zhe sdang skye ba /
analyzed: 'gro ba dge ba rnams zhe sdang skye ba /
translated: He is hostile to virtuous people.

original: byas pa mi gzo ba /
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo ba /
translated: He is not grateful.

original: nyon mongs pa spang bar dka' ba kha na ma tho ba che ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang bar dka' ba kha na ma tho ba che ba'o //
translated: It is difficult for him to give up his afflictions. He has great faults.

original: de dag la yang zhib tu ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /üîΩ'dod chags kyi spyod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la dga' ba gzhan dag gi yon tan phal cher tshol gyi nyes pa'i glags mi blta'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhib tu ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na / 'dod chags kyi spyod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la dga' ba gzhan dag gi yon tan phal cher tshol gyi nyes pa'i glags mi blta'o //
translated: How should one understand them in detail?üîΩThe behavior of the lustful is to delight in the qualities of the sense objects. He seeks out the qualities of others, but does not look for their faults.

original: zhe sdang can gyi spyod pa ni gang la yang chags pa mi che ba gzhan dag gi skyon dang / nyes pa phal cher tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang can gyi spyod pa ni gang la yang chags pa mi che ba gzhan dag gi skyon dang / nyes pa phal cher tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The behavior of the hateful is to have little attachment to anything. He seeks out the faults and failings of others.

original: gti mug can gyi spyod pa ni gang du yang mi gnas pa 'jog pa dang rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug can gyi spyod pa ni gang du yang mi gnas pa 'jog pa dang rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The conduct of the deluded is not to dwell anywhere, and is not of the nature of conceptualization.

original: sngon gyi spyod pa'i sgo nas brtags na /üîΩ'dod chags can ni sngon dge ba'i las phal cher byas pas bde ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i phyir mtho ris kyi gnas nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: sngon gyi spyod pa'i sgo nas brtags na / 'dod chags can ni sngon dge ba'i las phal cher byas pas bde ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i phyir mtho ris kyi gnas nas shi 'phos te /
translated: When examined from the perspective of past conduct,

original: 'dir skyes par blta'o //üîΩzhe sdang can ni sngon bsad pa dang bcad pa dang brdegs pa la sogs pa'i las phal cher byas pas sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir skyes par blta'o // zhe sdang can ni sngon bsad pa dang bcad pa dang brdegs pa la sogs pa'i las phal cher byas pas sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: it should be seen that the desirous, due to having previously performed virtuous actions, abide in the result of happiness and are reborn here from the heavenly realms.

original: klu'i skye gnas sam mi'i skye gnas na yang rtag tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa las shi 'phos nas 'dir skye ste /
analyzed: klu'i skye gnas sam mi'i skye gnas na yang rtag tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa las shi 'phos nas 'dir skye ste /
translated: The hateful, due to having previously performed actions such as killing, cutting, and beating, abide in constant suffering in the animal realm, the hungry ghost realm, or the human realm, and are reborn here from death in those realms.

original: sngon yang rtag tu sdug bsngal gyis sems dkrugs pas gar skyes pa der yang sems 'khrugs pa dang zhe sdang che bar @107a * //
analyzed: sngon yang rtag tu sdug bsngal gyis sems dkrugs pas gar skyes pa der yang sems 'khrugs pa dang zhe sdang che bar @107a * //
translated: Since their minds were previously disturbed by constant suffering, wherever they are born, their minds are disturbed and they have great hatred.

original: blta'o // gti mug can gyi spyod pa ni sngon gyi rgyu sngon chang mang du 'thungs pa'am /
analyzed: blta'o // gti mug can gyi spyod pa ni sngon gyi rgyu sngon chang mang du 'thungs pa'am /
translated: One should look at the conduct of the deluded person.

original: mnyan pa dang 'bri ba la sogs pa'i las ma byas pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skye bar blta'o //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang 'bri ba la sogs pa'i las ma byas pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skye bar blta'o //
translated: One should look at the person who has drunk a lot of alcohol in the past, or who has not done the work of listening and writing, etc., or who has died in the animal realm and been reborn here.

original: khams kyi rgyus brtags na sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ste /
analyzed: khams kyi rgyus brtags na sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ste /
translated: When one examines the cause of the elements, there are the four great elements: earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi shas mnyam na ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi shas mnyam na ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the four great elements are in balance, there is a predominance of passion.

original: me'i khams dang rlung gi khams shas che na ni zhe sdang che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i khams dang rlung gi khams shas che na ni zhe sdang che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the fire element and wind element are predominant, there is a predominance of hatred.

original: sa dang chu'i shas chen ni gti mug che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang chu'i shas chen ni gti mug che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the earth and water elements are predominant, there is a predominance of delusion.

original: nyes pa'i gleng gzhis brtags na rlung gi shas che ba rnams ni 'dod chags spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'i gleng gzhis brtags na rlung gi shas che ba rnams ni 'dod chags spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: When one examines by means of the discussion of faults, those with a predominance of wind are situated in the practice of passion.

original: mkhris pa'i shas che ba rnams ni zhe sdang che ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i shas che ba rnams ni zhe sdang che ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Those with a predominance of bile are situated in the practice of hatred.üîΩThose with a predominance of phlegm are situated in the practice of delusion.

original: bad kan gyi shas che ba rnams ni gti mug che ba rnams so //
analyzed: bad kan gyi shas che ba rnams ni gti mug che ba rnams so //
translated: Those with a predominance of phlegm are those with a predominance of delusion.

original: yang rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa brtags te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bdun gyi sgo nas rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa brtags te /
translated: Again, the conduct of the three types of persons is investigated from seven aspects.

original: rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / chos gos bgo ba dang / kha zas za ba dang / las byed pa dang nyal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / chos gos bgo ba dang / kha zas za ba dang / las byed pa dang nyal ba'o //
translated: The seven aspects are: object, affliction, destination, wearing Dharma robes, eating food, activity, and sleeping.

original: dmigs pa ji ltar brtag ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa ji ltar brtag ce na /
translated: How is the object investigated?

original: 'dod chags kyi shas che ba rnams ni gzugs 'ga' zhig mthong na ngo mtshar du gyur par lta zhing /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi shas che ba rnams ni gzugs 'ga' zhig mthong na ngo mtshar du gyur par lta zhing /
translated: Those with a predominance of desire, when seeing a certain form, look with wonder and

original: yun ring du lta ba la nyes pa zhig byung na yang nyes par mi lta yon tan cung zad tsam yang mtshar du bcug par byed la /
analyzed: yun ring du lta ba la nyes pa zhig byung na yang nyes par mi lta yon tan cung zad tsam yang mtshar du bcug par byed la /
translated: look for a long time. Even if a fault occurs, they do not see it as a fault. They make even a slight good quality into something wonderful.

original: gang mthong ba de dang 'bral bar mi dga' zhing bral na yang slar phrad par 'dod pa dang bcas te 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang mthong ba de dang 'bral bar mi dga' zhing bral na yang slar phrad par 'dod pa dang bcas te 'gro ba'o //
translated: They do not like to be separated from what they see, and when separated, they wish to meet again.

original: zhe sdang gi shas che ba gzugs 'ga' zhig mthong na mtshar du bya ba med kyi bral ba dang chad pa'i tshul du lta zhing /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi shas che ba gzugs 'ga' zhig mthong na mtshar du bya ba med kyi bral ba dang chad pa'i tshul du lta zhing /
translated: If they see some form that is dominated by anger, they do not find it delightful, but rather view it as something to be separated from and destroyed.

original: yun ring du mi lta la gzhan dag la yang nyes pa dang skyon tshol ba mang ba /
analyzed: yun ring du mi lta la gzhan dag la yang nyes pa dang skyon tshol ba mang ba /
translated: They do not look at it for long, and they often seek out the faults and shortcomings of others.

original: smod pa la dga' ba yon tan dang legs pa cher byas na yid mi rton pa /
analyzed: smod pa la dga' ba yon tan dang legs pa cher byas na yid mi rton pa /
translated: They delight in disparaging others and are not trustworthy even if they do something good or helpful.

original: gang mthong ba dang bral bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gang mthong ba dang bral bar 'dod la /
translated: They want to be separated from whatever they see.

original: mi dga' ba'i tshul bstan nas 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i tshul bstan nas 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: They act in a way that is unpleasant and then leave.

original: gti mug gi shas che ba ni gzugs 'ga' zhig mthong na yang nyes pa dang yon tan gyi ngo mi zin pa /üîΩgzhan dag gis smad na yang @107b rjes su smod la /
analyzed: gti mug gi shas che ba ni gzugs 'ga' zhig mthong na yang nyes pa dang yon tan gyi ngo mi zin pa / gzhan dag gis smad na yang @107b rjes su smod la /
translated: If they see some form that is dominated by delusion, they do not recognize its faults or its good qualities.üîΩEven if others disparage it, they disparage it in turn.

original: gzhan dag gis bstod na yang rjes su stod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bstod na yang rjes su stod par byed do //
translated: Even if others praise it, they praise it in turn.

original: bdag nyid kyi legs nyes kyi ngo mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi legs nyes kyi ngo mi shes pa'o //
translated: They do not recognize their own good and bad qualities.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
translated: How are they to be analyzed in terms of the mental afflictions?

original: 'dod chags kyi shas che ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa lnga la rtag tu spyod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi shas che ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa lnga la rtag tu spyod de /
translated: Those who are dominated by attachment always engage in five afflictions:

original: phrag dog dang ; ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / chags pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: phrag dog dang ; ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / chags pa dang lnga'o //
translated: envy, avarice, deceit, guile, and attachment.

original: zhe sdang gi shas che ba rnams kyang nyon mongs pa lnga la rtag tu spyod de /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi shas che ba rnams kyang nyon mongs pa lnga la rtag tu spyod de /
translated: Those who are dominated by aversion always engage in five afflictions:

original: lnga ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / khong khro ba dang lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / khong khro ba dang lnga'o //
translated: anger, resentment, hypocrisy, spite, and violence.

original: gti mug gi shas che ba ni ri nyon mongs pa lnga la rgyun du spyod de /
analyzed: gti mug gi shas che ba ni ri nyon mongs pa lnga la rgyun du spyod de /
translated: Those who are dominated by delusion always engage in five afflictions:

original: lnga ni le lo dang gnyid dang rmugs pa dang yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga ni le lo dang gnyid dang rmugs pa dang yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa dang lnga'o //
translated: sloth, sleep, doubt, regret, and excitation.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
translated: How are they classified according to their mode of going?

original: 'dod chags la spyod par 'gro ba na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod par 'gro ba na /
translated: Those who engage in attachment go

original: rkang pa mnyam du 'dor zhing dal bus 'gro ba gom pa mdzes par 'dor zhing 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa mnyam du 'dor zhing dal bus 'gro ba gom pa mdzes par 'dor zhing 'gro ba'o //
translated: with even feet, slowly, and with a beautiful gait.

original: zhe sdang la spyod par 'gro ba na /
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod par 'gro ba na /
translated: Those who engage in aversion go

original: rang bzhin gyis gom pa gya tshom du 'dor la rkang pa sa la gnon pa 'dra bar byas shing g-yas phyogs kyis 'gro'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gom pa gya tshom du 'dor la rkang pa sa la gnon pa 'dra bar byas shing g-yas phyogs kyis 'gro'o //
translated: He walks with a gait that is uncertain, as if he were stepping on thorns, and he walks with his right side toward the object.

original: gti mug la spyod par 'gro ba ni /üîΩrang bzhin gyis rkang pa sa la 'jog pa na /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod par 'gro ba ni / rang bzhin gyis rkang pa sa la 'jog pa na /
translated: One who is dominated by delusion walksüîΩas if he were stepping on soft ground.

original: brel bag tu 'jog la 'gro ba'i tshe rkang pa gnyis sa la 'cha' ba dang rkang pa gnyis gcig la gcig 'drud cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: brel bag tu 'jog la 'gro ba'i tshe rkang pa gnyis sa la 'cha' ba dang rkang pa gnyis gcig la gcig 'drud cing 'gro'o //
translated: He walks as if he were sinking down and sliding over the ground.

original: ji ltar chos gos gyon pa'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos gos gyon pa'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
translated: How should one examine a person in terms of how he wears his robes?

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis gos ha cang dog pa yang ma yin yangs pa yang ma yin pa la dga' ba dang / ska rags dam du mi 'ching la lhod par mi 'ching ba dang gos yid kyis ring ba la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis gos ha cang dog pa yang ma yin yangs pa yang ma yin pa la dga' ba dang / ska rags dam du mi 'ching la lhod par mi 'ching ba dang gos yid kyis ring ba la dga' ba ste /
translated: One who is dominated by attachment naturally likes robes that are neither too tight nor too loose, he does not tie his belt too tightly or too loosely, and he likes long robes.

original: sdu gu dang mdzes par byas nas gyon no //
analyzed: sdu gu dang mdzes par byas nas gyon no //
translated: He wears his robes neatly and attractively.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis gos dog pa la dga' zhing /
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis gos dog pa la dga' zhing /
translated: One who is dominated by aversion naturally likes tight robes.

original: ska rags dam du 'ching ba dang / gos thung ngu gyon cing gcig tu mdzes pa kho nar lta zhing gyon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ska rags dam du 'ching ba dang / gos thung ngu gyon cing gcig tu mdzes pa kho nar lta zhing gyon pa med pa'o //
translated: The belt is tied tightly, the lower garment is worn short, and one dresses in a way that is only beautiful.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis gos yangs pa la dga' zhing ska rags lhod par 'ching ba dang gos gcas gcus su mi mdzes par byas nas gyon pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis gos yangs pa la dga' zhing ska rags lhod par 'ching ba dang gos gcas gcus su mi mdzes par byas nas gyon pa'o //
translated: The one who engages in delusion naturally likes loose clothing, wears the belt loosely, and dresses in a way that is not beautiful.

original: 'di ltar kha zas za ba'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha zas za ba'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
translated: How should one investigate them through eating?

original: @108a * // 'dod chags la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis snum pa dang mngar ba'i kha zas la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: @108a * // 'dod chags la spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis snum pa dang mngar ba'i kha zas la dga' ba'o //
translated: The one who engages in desire naturally likes oily and sweet food.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni rtsub pa dang skyur ba'i kha zas la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni rtsub pa dang skyur ba'i kha zas la dga' ba'o //
translated: The one who engages in hatred likes rough and sour food.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni gang du yang gcig tu nges pa med do //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni gang du yang gcig tu nges pa med do //
translated: The one who engages in delusion does not have a definite preference.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa kha zas za ba na kham ran pa dang mdzes par byas nas chags bzhin du dal bus za la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa kha zas za ba na kham ran pa dang mdzes par byas nas chags bzhin du dal bus za la /
translated: When the one who engages in desire eats food, he eats slowly, with attachment, after making the morsels the right size and making them beautiful.

original: ro zhim po 'ga' zhig myangs na lhag par yid dga' ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: ro zhim po 'ga' zhig myangs na lhag par yid dga' ba skye ba'o //
translated: When he experiences some delicious food, he becomes especially happy.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa kha zas za ba na kham cher byas nas kha gang bar mi chags par myur du za ba la /
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa kha zas za ba na kham cher byas nas kha gang bar mi chags par myur du za ba la /
translated: When the one who practices hatred eats food, he eats quickly, not filling his mouth with large morsels.

original: kha zas zhim po 'ga' zhig myangs nas kyang lhag par yang yid mi bde bar skye ba'o //
analyzed: kha zas zhim po 'ga' zhig myangs nas kyang lhag par yang yid mi bde bar skye ba'o //
translated: When he experiences some delicious food, he becomes especially unhappy.

original: gti mug la spyod pa kha zas za ba na kham chung du byas la kha zas kyi kham yang mi mdzes par byas nas /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa kha zas za ba na kham chung du byas la kha zas kyi kham yang mi mdzes par byas nas /
translated: When the one who practices delusion eats food, he eats with small morsels, not making a beautiful mouthful of food.

original: lag pa dang kha la sogs pa kha zas kyis bskus te gang la yang chen por mi gtogs pa za'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang kha la sogs pa kha zas kyis bskus te gang la yang chen por mi gtogs pa za'o //
translated: He eats without paying attention to anything else, smearing his hands, mouth, etc. with food.

original: ji ltar las kyi sgo nas brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar las kyi sgo nas brtag ce na /
translated: How is it discerned by way of action?

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni phyags ma thogs nas dal bus phyag dar rnams dag par byas te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni phyags ma thogs nas dal bus phyag dar rnams dag par byas te /
translated: The one who practices passion sweeps slowly with a broom, cleaning well.

original: gcig kyang ma lus par phyags par byed do //
analyzed: gcig kyang ma lus par phyags par byed do //
translated: He sweeps without leaving anything behind.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni phyags ma blangs nas ring ba'i tshul du phyogs gnyis kar phyag dar 'dor zhing sgra dang bcas par drag tu phyags par byed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni phyags ma blangs nas ring ba'i tshul du phyogs gnyis kar phyag dar 'dor zhing sgra dang bcas par drag tu phyags par byed do //
translated: One who is dominated by hatred sweeps with a broom in a straight line, throwing the dust to both sides, and sweeps with a loud sound and with force.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni phyags ma thogs nas snyoms pa'i tshul du byed la phyag dar rnams kyang ma dag pa dang / mi mdzes par dal bus phyags par byed do //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni phyags ma thogs nas snyoms pa'i tshul du byed la phyag dar rnams kyang ma dag pa dang / mi mdzes par dal bus phyags par byed do //
translated: One who is dominated by delusion sweeps with a broom in a crooked line, and sweeps slowly, without removing the dust completely and without making it look nice.

original: de bzhin du las gzhan la yang brtag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du las gzhan la yang brtag ste /
translated: The same should be investigated with regard to other actions.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni las gang la yang mdzes pa dang gus par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni las gang la yang mdzes pa dang gus par byed do //
translated: One who is dominated by attachment does any action beautifully and respectfully.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni las gang la yang dag tu bsgrub pa la brtan por byed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni las gang la yang dag tu bsgrub pa la brtan por byed do //
translated: One who is dominated by hatred does any action with a firm grip.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni las gang la yang 'khrugs par byed la gcig tu mi byar mi rung bar chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni las gang la yang 'khrugs par byed la gcig tu mi byar mi rung bar chad pa med pa'o //
translated: One who is dominated by delusion does any action with a confused grip, and does not do it well or in a timely manner.

original: ji ltar nyal ba'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyal ba'i sgo nas brtag ce na /
translated: How is it investigated through sleep?

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa ni /
translated: One who is dominated by attachment

original: mal stan dal bus bcas la mdzes par byas nas nyal ba na yang lus bskum ste nyal lo //
analyzed: mal stan dal bus bcas la mdzes par byas nas nyal ba na yang lus bskum ste nyal lo //
translated: When going to bed, he or she arranges the bedding carefully and beautifully, and then lies down slowly and gracefully.

original: nang par langs pa yang myur du ldang zhing @108b 'dong ba'am /
analyzed: nang par langs pa yang myur du ldang zhing @108b 'dong ba'am /
translated: When rising in the morning, he or she gets up quickly and dresses.

original: skrag pa dang bcas pa dang 'dra bar tshig dal bus 'byin to //
analyzed: skrag pa dang bcas pa dang 'dra bar tshig dal bus 'byin to //
translated: He or she speaks slowly, as if fearful.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni mal stan 'cha' na yang myur du bcas nas gang ji ltar rung bar yang byas te /
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni mal stan 'cha' na yang myur du bcas nas gang ji ltar rung bar yang byas te /
translated: When making a bed, the person who is dominated by hatred makes it quickly, in any way at all.

original: rkang lag brkyang nas khro gnyer dang bcas par nyal lo //
analyzed: rkang lag brkyang nas khro gnyer dang bcas par nyal lo //
translated: He or she lies down with the limbs stretched out and a frown on the face.

original: nang par ldang na yang myur du langs la khros pa bzhin du tshig drag tu 'byin to //
analyzed: nang par ldang na yang myur du langs la khros pa bzhin du tshig drag tu 'byin to //
translated: When rising in the morning, he or she gets up quickly and speaks harshly, as if angry.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni mal stan las langs te /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni mal stan las langs te /
translated: When making a bed, the person who is dominated by confusion makes it slowly and with difficulty.

original: langs der bcas la nyal ba na yang kha sbub tu byas shing nyal lo //
analyzed: langs der bcas la nyal ba na yang kha sbub tu byas shing nyal lo //
translated: When lying down, he or she lies down on the stomach.

original: nang par langs na yang tshig ci yin gtol med par mi gsal bar 'byin cing dus tha gi zad cing lon nas gdod mal nas ldang ngo //
analyzed: nang par langs na yang tshig ci yin gtol med par mi gsal bar 'byin cing dus tha gi zad cing lon nas gdod mal nas ldang ngo //
translated: When rising in the morning, he or she gets up slowly and speaks indistinctly, as if absentminded.

original: de ltar spyod pa rnam pa gsum la spyod pa gang la chos gos ci 'dra ba dang bsod snyoms ji lta bu dang mal stan ci 'dra ba dang spyod yul gyi grong khyer gang du gzhag pa bstan dgos te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa rnam pa gsum la spyod pa gang la chos gos ci 'dra ba dang bsod snyoms ji lta bu dang mal stan ci 'dra ba dang spyod yul gyi grong khyer gang du gzhag pa bstan dgos te /
translated: Thus, it is necessary to teach what kind of Dharma robes, what kind of alms, what kind of bedding and seats, and what kind of village for a range of activity are appropriate for those who practice the three kinds of conduct.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa'i chos rnams la dgod dgos pas dge slong dag dge slong bud med mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa'i chos rnams la dgod dgos pas dge slong dag dge slong bud med mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, those who practice desire should be set in the Dharma of meditation on impurity. Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúMonks, when a monk sees a woman‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la ni byams pa bsgom pa la dgod de /
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la ni byams pa bsgom pa la dgod de /
translated: Those who practice aversion should be set in the meditation on love.

original: de ni 'og nas tshad med pa bzhi bstan pa'i skabs nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas tshad med pa bzhi bstan pa'i skabs nas 'chad do //
translated: This will be explained below in the section on teaching the four immeasurables.

original: gti mug la spyod pa rnams la ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gzhag ste /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa rnams la ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gzhag ste /
translated: Those who practice delusion should be set in dependent origination.

original: de'i tshul ji lta bu ni gong du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i tshul ji lta bu ni gong du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: The method for that has already been explained above in the section on teaching the twelve factors of dependent origination.

original: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la ni chos gos thung ba dang rtsub pa sbyin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la ni chos gos thung ba dang rtsub pa sbyin no //
translated: For those who practice with passion, one gives a short and rough Dharma robe.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la ni chos gos gtsang ma dang kha dog bzang ba dang ring ba dang mdzes pa sbyin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la ni chos gos gtsang ma dang kha dog bzang ba dang ring ba dang mdzes pa sbyin no //
translated: For those who practice with aversion, one gives a clean, good-colored, long, and beautiful Dharma robe.

original: gti mug la spyod pa rnams la ni gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa rnams la ni gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: For those who practice with delusion, one gives whatever is appropriate.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la ni bsod snyoms rtsub pa dang mi zhim pa dang nyung du sbyin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la ni bsod snyoms rtsub pa dang mi zhim pa dang nyung du sbyin no //
translated: For those who practice with passion, one gives a rough, unappetizing, and small alms-offering.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la ni bsod snyoms 'jam pa dang / gtsang ba dang / zhim pa dang / tshim par gyur gyi bar du sbyin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams la ni bsod snyoms 'jam pa dang / gtsang ba dang / zhim pa dang / tshim par gyur gyi bar du sbyin no //
translated: For those who practice with aversion, one gives a soft, clean, delicious, and satisfying alms-offering.

original: gti mug la spyod pa rnams la ni gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa rnams la ni gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: For those who practice with delusion, one gives whatever is appropriate.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la mal @109a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams la mal @109a * //
translated: For those who practice with passion, one gives a bed

original: stan ni dur khrod dang dur khrod la nye ba'am /
analyzed: stan ni dur khrod dang dur khrod la nye ba'am /
translated: in a charnel ground or near a charnel ground,

original: gtsug la sogs pa yang las su rung ba ma byas pa /
analyzed: gtsug la sogs pa yang las su rung ba ma byas pa /
translated: or on a threshing floor, and so on, that is not well prepared.

original: gding ba dang dgab pa phun sum tshogs pa med par gzhag go //üîΩzhe sdang la spyod pa rnams kyi mal stan ni shing dang chu phun sum tshogs pas gzhi mnyam zhing mdzes pa'am /
analyzed: gding ba dang dgab pa phun sum tshogs pa med par gzhag go // zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams kyi mal stan ni shing dang chu phun sum tshogs pas gzhi mnyam zhing mdzes pa'am /
translated: He should set up the bedding and covering in such a way that they are not luxurious.

original: gtsug lag khang mdzes par byas pa gding ba dang mal stan phun sum tshogs par gzhag go //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang mdzes par byas pa gding ba dang mal stan phun sum tshogs par gzhag go //
translated: For those who are dominated by hatred, the bed should be set up on a level, pleasant surface, with plenty of wood and water, or in a pleasant monastery, with good bedding and a bed.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni gang du yang rung ngo //üîΩ'dod chags la spyod pa rnams kyi spyod yul gyi grong rnams kha zas rtsub po mang du za zhing grong khyer rnams mi mdzes pa la 'gro ba phos gang bar gzhag go //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni gang du yang rung ngo // 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams kyi spyod yul gyi grong rnams kha zas rtsub po mang du za zhing grong khyer rnams mi mdzes pa la 'gro ba phos gang bar gzhag go //
translated: For those who are dominated by delusion, it should be set up anywhere.üîΩFor those who are dominated by attachment, the village in which they practice should be one where the food is coarse, and the village should be ugly, and full of men.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams kyi spyod yul gyi grong khyer ni kha zas phun sum tshogs pa dang grong khyer mdzes pa dang 'gro ba dad pa bsgrub pa mang bar gzhag go //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams kyi spyod yul gyi grong khyer ni kha zas phun sum tshogs pa dang grong khyer mdzes pa dang 'gro ba dad pa bsgrub pa mang bar gzhag go //
translated: For those who are dominated by hatred, the village in which they practice should be one where the food is good, and the village should be pleasant, and full of faithful people.

original: gti mug gi spyod yul gyi grong khyer ni gang du yang rung la 'gro ba mkhas pa phal tshar yod pa'i gnas su gzhag go //
analyzed: gti mug gi spyod yul gyi grong khyer ni gang du yang rung la 'gro ba mkhas pa phal tshar yod pa'i gnas su gzhag go //
translated: The city of the sphere of delusion is any place where the majority of the wise people are defeated.

original: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of people who practice desire:

original: reg pa la chags pa dang / rang bzhin la chags pa dang / kha dog la chags pa dang / nye bar spyod pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa la chags pa dang / rang bzhin la chags pa dang / kha dog la chags pa dang / nye bar spyod pa la chags pa'o //
translated: those who are attached to touch, those who are attached to nature, those who are attached to color, and those who are attached to service.

original: de la reg pa la chags pa ni /
analyzed: de la reg pa la chags pa ni /
translated: Among them, those who are attached to touch

original: reg bya 'jam pa la chags pa ste /
analyzed: reg bya 'jam pa la chags pa ste /
translated: are attached to soft touch.

original: des rus pa dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des rus pa dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: For them, they should meditate on white bones.

original: rang bzhin la chags pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin la chags pa ni /
translated: Those who are attached to nature

original: bud med la sogs pa'i lus kyi ngo bo ma nyams pa la chags pa ste /
analyzed: bud med la sogs pa'i lus kyi ngo bo ma nyams pa la chags pa ste /
translated: are attached to the undamaged essence of the body of a woman and so on.

original: de bam pa dang sbos pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bam pa dang sbos pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: For them, they should meditate on a bloated corpse and so on.

original: kha dog la chags pa rnams kyis ni rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog la chags pa rnams kyis ni rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those who are attached to color should meditate on a livid corpse and so on.

original: nye bar spyod pa la chags pa rnams kyis ni bud med la sogs pa'i lus dur khrod du bor ba sems med de shing bzhin du gnas pa la bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa la chags pa rnams kyis ni bud med la sogs pa'i lus dur khrod du bor ba sems med de shing bzhin du gnas pa la bsgom pa'o //
translated: Those who are attached to sexual intercourse should meditate on the body of a woman, etc., as a corpse thrown away in the charnel ground, devoid of consciousness, like a piece of wood.

original: bdag dang bud med kyi phyi nang gi lus la rnam par 'jig pa ni 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi char gyi gnyen por 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bdag dang bud med kyi phyi nang gi lus la rnam par 'jig pa ni 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi char gyi gnyen por 'gyur bas /
translated: The internal and external body of oneself and of a woman is the antidote to all four types of lust.

original: mdo 'di las de nyid gtso bor mdzad de gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo 'di las de nyid gtso bor mdzad de gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the S≈´tra emphasizes just that.

original: de la bud med kyi lus ni phyi'i lus so //
analyzed: de la bud med kyi lus ni phyi'i lus so //
translated: Among them, the body of a woman is the external body.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus ni nang gi lus so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus ni nang gi lus so //
translated: One‚Äôs own body is the internal body.

original: yang na skra dang spu dang sen mo dang so dang rdul dang dri ma dang / @109b pags pa ni phyi'i lus so //
analyzed: yang na skra dang spu dang sen mo dang so dang rdul dang dri ma dang / @109b pags pa ni phyi'i lus so //
translated: Alternatively, hair of the head, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, dirt, and filth are the external body.

original: sha dang rus pa nas bshad pa dang gci ba'i bar du gsungs pa ni nang gi lus so //
analyzed: sha dang rus pa nas bshad pa dang gci ba'i bar du gsungs pa ni nang gi lus so //
translated: Flesh, bones, marrow, and the contents of the belly, up to feces and urine, are the internal body.

original: de la mgo las skyes pa ni skra'o //
analyzed: de la mgo las skyes pa ni skra'o //
translated: Among them, that which grows from the head is hair of the head.

original: mchan khung dang kha la sogs pa'i lus las skyes pa ni spu ste /
analyzed: mchan khung dang kha la sogs pa'i lus las skyes pa ni spu ste /
translated: That which grows from the armpits, mouth, etc., is body hair.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus de ltar brtags nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus de ltar brtags nas /
translated: Having examined one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô bodies in this way,

original: ji ltar brtags pa la goms par byas na 'dod chags 'jil bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa la goms par byas na 'dod chags 'jil bar 'gyur te /
translated: one should cultivate familiarity with the way they are examined.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúright mindfulness.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach right concentration,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is right concentration?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos la sems rtse gcig pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos la sems rtse gcig pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: Thus, right concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on wholesome dharmas.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi yang dge ba'i chos la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi yang dge ba'i chos la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The four meditations of the form realm are also characterized by the one-pointedness of mind on wholesome dharmas, and so are called ‚Äúright concentration.‚Äù

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Among them, the first meditation is endowed with five members.

original: yan lag lnga la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: The five members are investigation, analysis, joy, bliss, and one-pointedness of mind.

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The second meditative concentration has four branches.üîΩThe four branches are: inner clarity,

analyzed: yan lag bzhi la nang rab tu dang ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: bliss, and one-pointed mind.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The third meditative concentration has five branches.üîΩThe five branches are: equanimity,

original: yan lag lnga la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: mindfulness, alertness, bliss, and one-pointed mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The fourth meditative concentration has four branches.üîΩThe four branches are: equanimity,

original: yan lag bzhi la btang snyoms rab tu dga' ba dang dran pa dang rab tu dga' ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi la btang snyoms rab tu dga' ba dang dran pa dang rab tu dga' ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain, and one-pointed mind.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag la yan lag bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag la yan lag bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, these four meditative concentrations have eighteen branches.

analyzed: yan lag bco brgyad ni bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga /
translated: The first meditative concentration has five branches.

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste bcu dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la yang yan lag bzhi /

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste brgyad de ltar na bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //

original: bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag zhib tu 'chad @110a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag zhib tu 'chad @110a * //
translated: The detailed explanation of these four meditative absorptions

original: pa ni / phyis bsam gtan gyi skabs su 'chad pas /
analyzed: pa ni / phyis bsam gtan gyi skabs su 'chad pas /
translated: will be explained later in the section on the meditative absorptions.

analyzed: 'dir bshad na dgos pa chung la bya ba che ba'i phyir ni ma bshad do //
translated: If we were to explain them here, it would be of little purpose and much difficulty, so I will not explain them.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After the explanation of the four noble truths,üîΩthe twenty-two faculties were taught.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to explain them as they were taught,

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, What are the twenty-two faculties? and so on.

original: dbang po rnams bstan pa ci dgos she na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams bstan pa ci dgos she na /
translated: Why are the faculties taught?

original: smras pa / dbang po bstan pas /
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po bstan pas /
translated: It is said:üîΩBy teaching the faculties,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'byung bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i chos khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'byung bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i chos khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand the mundane and supramundane, the contaminated and uncontaminated, the active and non-active, the common and uncommon dharmas,

original: chos de dag khong du chud na bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos de dag khong du chud na bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: when one understands those dharmas, one abandons attachment to self and what belongs to self.

original: mngon par chags pa spangs na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa spangs na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When attachment is abandoned, the suffering of cyclic existence is eliminated.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal med na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal med na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the suffering of cyclic existence is eliminated, the happiness of nirvana is attained.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal spang ba dang / bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dbang po bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal spang ba dang / bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dbang po bstan to //
translated: Thus, the faculties are taught in order to abandon suffering and attain happiness.

original: de la mig gi dbang po'i rdul phran ni mig gi sprin gyi nang na go snyod kyi me tog kha 'bus pa 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po'i rdul phran ni mig gi sprin gyi nang na go snyod kyi me tog kha 'bus pa 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: In this regard, the atoms of the eye faculty reside in the eye cloud like the opening of a dill flower.

original: rna ba'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni gro ga gcus pa'i mdud pa 'dra bar rna ba'i nang na gnas so //üîΩsna'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni lcags kyi thur ma ltar mtshul pa'i nang thog thag tu gnas so //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni gro ga gcus pa'i mdud pa 'dra bar rna ba'i nang na gnas so // sna'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni lcags kyi thur ma ltar mtshul pa'i nang thog thag tu gnas so //
translated: The particles of the ear sense-faculty are arranged like a rolled up palm-leaf, inside the ear.üîΩThe particles of the nose sense-faculty are arranged like a needle, in the middle of the cavity of the nostril.

original: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni zla ba kham pa 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phran ni zla ba kham pa 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: The particles of the tongue sense-faculty are arranged like a half-moon on the upper surface of the tongue.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phran ni lus bzhin du thog thag tu khyab par gnas so //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phran ni lus bzhin du thog thag tu khyab par gnas so //
translated: The particles of the body sense-faculty are arranged like the shape of the body, covering the entire body.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni rdul phran bsags pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas chos thams cad shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩbud med kyi dbang po'i rdul phran ni rnga'i kha bzhin nam shing ba la btsal ba 'dra bar gsang ba'i phyogs na gnas so //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni rdul phran bsags pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas chos thams cad shes pa'i mtshan nyid do // bud med kyi dbang po'i rdul phran ni rnga'i kha bzhin nam shing ba la btsal ba 'dra bar gsang ba'i phyogs na gnas so //
translated: The mental faculty, not being composed of particles, is the characteristic of the knowledge of all dharmas.üîΩThe particles of the female sexual faculty are arranged like a drum, or like a thumb.

original: skyes pa'i dbang po'i rdul phra mo khyud skor gyi phyogs na mdzub mo ltar gnas so //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po'i rdul phra mo khyud skor gyi phyogs na mdzub mo ltar gnas so //
translated: The particles of the male sexual faculty are arranged like a bamboo sprout.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po ni ris mthun pa'i phung po gnas pa dang / mi 'jig par 'dzin par byed @110b pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po ni ris mthun pa'i phung po gnas pa dang / mi 'jig par 'dzin par byed @110b pa'o //
translated: The faculty of life-force is that which holds the aggregates of the same type together and prevents their destruction.

original: kha cig na re phung pa rgyun 'brel par gnas pa ni 'tsho ba'i dbang po'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re phung pa rgyun 'brel par gnas pa ni 'tsho ba'i dbang po'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some say: The faculty of life-force is the continuity of the aggregates remaining in a connected series.

original: la la na re drod dang rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba chen po gnas pa la dbang byed pa ni 'tsho ba'i dbang po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re drod dang rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba chen po gnas pa la dbang byed pa ni 'tsho ba'i dbang po zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The faculty of life-force is the controlling power of the great elements that possess heat and consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i bar du ci'i phyir dbang po lnga bshad ce na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i bar du ci'i phyir dbang po lnga bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the five faculties from the faculty of suffering to the faculty of equanimity explained?

original: dbang po lnga po de dag bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga po de dag bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ste /
translated: These five faculties are adverse to the absorptions and meditative attainments.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa lnga yod pas na sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga nyid du bshad do//
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa lnga yod pas na sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga nyid du bshad do//
translated: Since there are five types of adverse factors, the five faculties from the faculty of suffering are explained.

original: de la bsam gtan dang pos yid mi bde ba'i dbang po 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang pos yid mi bde ba'i dbang po 'joms par byed do //
translated: The first absorption conquers the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pas ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pas ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po 'joms par byed do //
translated: The second meditation destroys the faculty of suffering.

original: bsam gtan gsum pas ni bde ba'i dbang po 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pas ni bde ba'i dbang po 'joms par byed do //
translated: The third meditation destroys the faculty of pleasure.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pas ni yid bde ba'i dbang po bcom nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnam par dag pa la gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pas ni yid bde ba'i dbang po bcom nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnam par dag pa la gnas so //
translated: The fourth meditation, having destroyed the faculty of satisfaction, is established in the faculty of equanimity which is pure.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa lnga ste /
translated: In the realm of desire, there are five consciousnesses.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i mig dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i mig dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: In the first meditation, there are the consciousnesses of the eye, ear, and body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag gi sim pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag gi sim pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the agreeable sensation associated with these groups of consciousness.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni yid kyi sim pa gang yin pa la yang bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni yid kyi sim pa gang yin pa la yang bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: In the third meditation, the agreeable mental sensation is also called the faculty of pleasure.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyi sim pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyi sim pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: The disagreeable sensation associated with the five groups of consciousness

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ste /
translated: is called the faculty of suffering.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams nyid na yod kyi /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams nyid na yod kyi /
translated: It exists only in the realm of desire.

original: khams gzhan na med do //
analyzed: khams gzhan na med do //
translated: It does not exist in other realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni las mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni las mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the realm of form and the formless realm, there is no ripening of nonvirtuous karma.

original: yid la sim pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: yid la sim pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba'i dbang po ste /
translated: Whatever feeling is mental satisfaction is the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa na yod do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa na yod do //
translated: It exists in the desire realm, the first and second absorptions.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: The faculty of equanimity exists in the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: sa thams cad na yod do //üîΩyang na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma @111a * //
analyzed: sa thams cad na yod do // yang na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma @111a * //
translated: It exists on all levels.

original: yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum lus dang sems kyi rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas dbang po rnam pa lngar gzhag ste /
analyzed: yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum lus dang sems kyi rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas dbang po rnam pa lngar gzhag ste /
translated: Or, the three types of feeling‚Äîpleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant‚Äîare posited as five faculties from the perspective of the different supports of body and mind.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba yang lus las byung zhing lus dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba yang lus las byung zhing lus dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the feeling of pleasure arises from the body and is related to the body, it is called the faculty of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba de nyid sems dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni yid bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba de nyid sems dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni yid bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When that very pleasant feeling is associated with the mind, it is called the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang lus dang 'brel cing lus las byung ba'i dus na ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang lus dang 'brel cing lus las byung ba'i dus na ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the feeling of pain is associated with the body and arises from the body, it is called the faculty of pain.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de nyid sems dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de nyid sems dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When that very feeling of pain is associated with the mind, it is called the faculty of mental distress.

original: lus dang sems gnyi ga dang 'brel ba /
analyzed: lus dang sems gnyi ga dang 'brel ba /
translated: When it is associated with both body and mind,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyi gar mi rtog pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyi gar mi rtog pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: and neither pleasure nor pain is being experienced, it is the faculty of equanimity.

original: yang na dbang po lnga'i gzhi la brten nas yid du mi 'ong ba'i yul la dmigs te /
analyzed: yang na dbang po lnga'i gzhi la brten nas yid du mi 'ong ba'i yul la dmigs te /
translated: Or, based on the five faculties, when one focuses on an unpleasant object,

original: rnam par rtog pa med par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang yang dag par ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang yang dag par ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
translated: and is endowed with the five kinds of cognition that are free from conceptualization, this is the faculty of pain.

original: yid kyi dbang po la brten nas yul yid du mi 'ong ba la dmigs shing rtog pa dang bcas shing yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po la brten nas yul yid du mi 'ong ba la dmigs shing rtog pa dang bcas shing yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is the faculty of the mind as support, the object of the mind that is unpleasant, the mental activity of reflection, and the mental consciousness that is associated with them.

original: dbang po lnga la brten nas /
analyzed: dbang po lnga la brten nas /
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the five faculties as support,

original: yul yid du 'ong ba la dmigs shing rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang yang dag par ldan pa ni //üîΩbde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yul yid du 'ong ba la dmigs shing rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang yang dag par ldan pa ni // bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: the object of the mind that is pleasant, and the five consciousnesses that are associated with them.üîΩThe faculty of mental pleasure is the faculty of the mind as support, the object of the mind that is pleasant, the mental activity of reflection, and the mental consciousness that is associated with them.

original: yid kyi dbang po la brten nas yul yid du 'ong ba la dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa dang bcas shing yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yid kyi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po la brten nas yul yid du 'ong ba la dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa dang bcas shing yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yid kyi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is the faculty of the mind as support, the object of the mind that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, the mental activity of equanimity, and the mental consciousness that is associated with them.

original: dbang po drug la brten nas yul yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin yid du mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa la dmigs shing rtog pa med pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnams par shes pa drug dang yang dag par ldan pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug la brten nas yul yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin yid du mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa la dmigs shing rtog pa med pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnams par shes pa drug dang yang dag par ldan pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is the six consciousnesses that are neither pleasant nor unpleasant, neither associated with nor dissociated from conceptualization, and that are based on the six faculties.

original: yang na bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pain and the faculty of sorrow are the results of the evolution of unmeritorious action.

original: bsod nams kyi 'du byed kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ba ni bde ba'i dbang po @111b dang yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'du byed kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ba ni bde ba'i dbang po @111b dang yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure and the faculty of satisfaction are the results of the evolution of meritorious action.

original: mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin par myong ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin par myong ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is the result of the evolution of unwavering action.

original: yang na lus dang dbang po dang yid dang blo la gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa na yang sdug bsngal /
analyzed: yang na lus dang dbang po dang yid dang blo la gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa na yang sdug bsngal /
translated: Or else, when it is born, it harms the body, the faculties, the mind and the mental organ; it is suffering.

original: gnas pa na yang sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: gnas pa na yang sdug bsngal la /
translated: When it persists, it is suffering.

original: yongs su gyur pa na bde bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa na bde bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When it changes, it is suffering. This is the faculty of suffering and the faculty of sorrow.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo dang yid la rjes su phan par byed pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa na yang bde /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo dang yid la rjes su phan par byed pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa na yang bde /
translated: When it is born, it benefits the body, the faculties, the mind and the mental organ; it is pleasure.

original: gnas pa na yang bde /
analyzed: gnas pa na yang bde /
translated: When it persists, it is pleasure.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba na sdug bsngal ba ni bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba na sdug bsngal ba ni bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When it changes, it is suffering. This is the faculty of pleasure.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo dang yid la gnod par yang mi byed /üîΩphan par yang mi byed cing shes pa ma skyes na ni sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo dang yid la gnod par yang mi byed / phan par yang mi byed cing shes pa ma skyes na ni sdug bsngal la /
translated: When it is born, it neither harms nor benefits the body, the faculties, the mind and the mental organ; it is neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.üîΩWhen it persists, it is neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.üîΩWhen it changes, it is suffering. This is the faculty of neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.üîΩWhen it is born, it neither harms nor benefits the body, the faculties, the mind and the mental organ; it is neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.üîΩWhen it persists, it is neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.

original: ye shes skyes na ni bde ba ste de lta bu med pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: ye shes skyes na ni bde ba ste de lta bu med pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: When it changes, it is suffering. This is the faculty of neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / rjes su 'brel ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / rjes su 'brel ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the faculty of suffering and the faculty of sorrow are associated with the suffering of suffering.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel ba ni bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel ba ni bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure and the faculty of satisfaction are associated with the suffering of change.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'brel ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'brel ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is associated with the suffering of the formative forces.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni phrad par mi 'dod pa'i sred pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni phrad par mi 'dod pa'i sred pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Or else, the faculty of suffering and the faculty of sorrow give rise to craving for separation from what is not desired and craving for union with what is desired.

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba'i dbang pos ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang phrad par 'dod pa'i sred pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba'i dbang pos ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang phrad par 'dod pa'i sred pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The faculty of pleasure and the faculty of satisfaction give rise to craving for union with what is desired and craving for non-separation from what is desired.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni kun tu gti mug pa'i sred pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni kun tu gti mug pa'i sred pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The faculty of equanimity gives rise to craving for the delusion of both.

original: yang na gnod par dang bcas pa'i lus kyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: yang na gnod par dang bcas pa'i lus kyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
translated: Or else, painful bodily feeling is the faculty of suffering.

original: gnod par dang bcas pa'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gnod par dang bcas pa'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: Painful mental feeling is the faculty of sorrow.

original: gnod pa med pa'i lus kyi tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //üîΩgnod pa med pa'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i lus kyi tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o // gnod pa med pa'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: Pleasant bodily feeling is the faculty of pleasure.üîΩPleasant mental feeling is the faculty of joy.

original: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //üîΩyang na khams 'khrugs pa las skyes pa'am bdag gam gzhan gyis @112a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o // yang na khams 'khrugs pa las skyes pa'am bdag gam gzhan gyis @112a * //
translated: Neutral feeling is the faculty of equanimity, which is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: gnod pa byas pa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa las byung ba'am /
translated: Or else, the faculty of suffering is bodily painful feeling, which arises from the disturbance of the elements, or from the harm of others, or from the harm of oneself,

original: 'chi ba'i dus na sdug bsngal myong ba'am /üîΩspyod lam mi bde bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na sdug bsngal myong ba'am / spyod lam mi bde bar gnas pa ste /
translated: or from the experience of suffering at the time of death,üîΩor from the experience of suffering in an unpleasant posture.

original: bde ba'i ro dang bral ba'i lus kyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i ro dang bral ba'i lus kyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
translated: It is bodily feeling that is devoid of the taste of pleasure.

original: mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / skyo ba dang nga rgyal dang 'jigs pa dang smad pa dang / chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa'i bde ba dang bral ba'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / skyo ba dang nga rgyal dang 'jigs pa dang smad pa dang / chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa'i bde ba dang bral ba'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: Mental feeling that is unpleasant is the faculty of mental sorrow, which is mental feeling that is born from the conception of meeting with the unpleasant, separation from the pleasant, sorrow, pride, fear, contempt, punishment, and so on.

original: khams mnyam par gyur pa las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: khams mnyam par gyur pa las skyes pa'am /
translated: It is born from the harmony of the elements.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen pos sdug bsngal bcom pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen pos sdug bsngal bcom pa'am /
translated: It is born from the destruction of suffering by the antidote to suffering.

original: spyod lam bde bar gnas pa'am /
analyzed: spyod lam bde bar gnas pa'am /
translated: It is born from the ease of the posture.üîΩIt is born from the relaxation of the body.

original: lus bag yangs kyis bskyed pa ro dang bcas pa'i lus kyi tshor ba ni yid bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: lus bag yangs kyis bskyed pa ro dang bcas pa'i lus kyi tshor ba ni yid bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Pleasant feeling is the faculty of mental pleasure, which is bodily feeling that is born from contact with a pleasant object.

original: yul yid du 'ong ba dang phrad par gyur la /
analyzed: yul yid du 'ong ba dang phrad par gyur la /
translated: It is born from contact with a pleasant object.

original: yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang / thag ring bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang / thag ring bar gyur pa'am /
translated: It is born from the absence of an unpleasant object.

original: grags pa dang bsngags pa la sogs pa'i yon tan la rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i ro dang bcas pa'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: grags pa dang bsngags pa la sogs pa'i yon tan la rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i ro dang bcas pa'i yid kyi tshor ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: Mental feeling that arises from the taste of conceptual thinking about the qualities of fame, praise, etc., is the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: lus dang yid la phan pa dang gnod par yang mi byed pa'i lus la sems kyi tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: lus dang yid la phan pa dang gnod par yang mi byed pa'i lus la sems kyi tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: Mental feeling that neither benefits nor harms the body or mind is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni gcig tu ma nges pa'i btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni gcig tu ma nges pa'i btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: It is the faculty of equanimity that is not definitely one or the other.

original: ci'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga nyid du bshad pa'i drug dang bzhi la sogs par ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga nyid du bshad pa'i drug dang bzhi la sogs par ma yin /
translated: Why are only five faculties such as faith explained, and not six, four, etc.?

original: smras pa / stobs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs lnga yod pas na dad pa la sogs pa lnga nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: smras pa / stobs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs lnga yod pas na dad pa la sogs pa lnga nyid du bshad de /
translated: It is said: Since there are five opposing factors to the powers, only five such as faith are explained,

original: drug dang bzhi la sogs par ma yin no //
analyzed: drug dang bzhi la sogs par ma yin no //
translated: and not six, four, etc.

original: stobs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs lnga ni ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / mi dran pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs lnga ni ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / mi dran pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / shes pa med pa'o //
translated: The five opposing factors to the powers are lack of faith, laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and lack of knowledge.

original: de la ma dad pa'i gnyen po ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la ma dad pa'i gnyen po ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The antidote to lack of faith is the faculty of faith.

original: le lo'i gnyen po ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: le lo'i gnyen po ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The antidote to laziness is the faculty of effort.

original: mi dran pa'i gnyen po ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi dran pa'i gnyen po ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The antidote to lack of mindfulness is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: g-yengs pa'i gnyen po ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: g-yengs pa'i gnyen po ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The antidote to distraction is the faculty of concentration.

original: mi shes pa'i gnyen po ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i gnyen po ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The antidote to ignorance is the faculty of wisdom.

original: yang na mos pa rnam pa lnga'i phyir dbang po lngar bshad de /
analyzed: yang na mos pa rnam pa lnga'i phyir dbang po lngar bshad de /
translated: Or else, the five faculties are explained as antidotes to the five kinds of lack of confidence.üîΩThe five kinds of lack of confidence are:

original: mos pa rnam pa lnga ni kha cig dad pa'i sgo @112b la mos te /
analyzed: mos pa rnam pa lnga ni kha cig dad pa'i sgo @112b la mos te /
translated: Some lack confidence in the door of faith,

original: dper na 'phags pa bar ka la bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa bar ka la bzhin no //
translated: like the noble Baka.

original: kha cig brtson 'grus kyi sgo la mos te /
analyzed: kha cig brtson 'grus kyi sgo la mos te /
translated: Some lack confidence in the door of effort,

original: dper na 'phags pa thos na rna ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa thos na rna ba bzhin no //
translated: like the noble one who hears and is like an ear.

original: kha cig dran pa'i sgo la mos te /
analyzed: kha cig dran pa'i sgo la mos te /
translated: Some lack confidence in the door of mindfulness,

original: dper na 'phags pa ming chen bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa ming chen bzhin no //
translated: like the noble Mahanama.

original: kha cig zhi gnas kyi sgo la mos te /
analyzed: kha cig zhi gnas kyi sgo la mos te /
translated: Some lack confidence in the door of tranquility,

original: dper na 'phags par re ba ti bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags par re ba ti bzhin no //
translated: like the noble one who hopes.

original: kha cig shes rab kyi sgo la mos te /
analyzed: kha cig shes rab kyi sgo la mos te /
translated: Some lack confidence in the door of wisdom,üîΩlike the noble one who is like a stump.

original: dper na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i sras po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i sras po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the noble son of the ≈öƒÅriputra.

original: de la gang dad pa'i sgo la mos pa rnams ni dad pa'i dbang po la brten nas khams gsum las 'byung bar byed de /
analyzed: de la gang dad pa'i sgo la mos pa rnams ni dad pa'i dbang po la brten nas khams gsum las 'byung bar byed de /
translated: Among them, those who are devoted to the door of faith, based on the faculty of faith, cause the emergence from the three realms.

original: de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba rnams la brten to //
analyzed: de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba rnams la brten to //
translated: They rely on the four branches of stream-entry that will be explained below.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la mos pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi la brten nas brtson 'grus kyi khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
