analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la mos pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi la brten nas brtson 'grus kyi khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Those who are devoted to the faculty of effort, based on the four right efforts, cause the emergence from the three realms through the element of effort.

original: dran pa'i dbang po la mos pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas dran pa'i dbang pos khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po la mos pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas dran pa'i dbang pos khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Those who are devoted to the faculty of mindfulness, based on the four establishments of mindfulness, cause the emergence from the three realms through the faculty of mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la mos pa rnams ni bsam gtan bzhi la brten nas ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la mos pa rnams ni bsam gtan bzhi la brten nas ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Those who are devoted to the faculty of concentration, based on the four concentrations, cause the emergence from the three realms through the faculty of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po la mos pa rnams ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po la mos pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who are devoted to the faculty of wisdom,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa la brten nas shes rab kyi khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa la brten nas shes rab kyi khams gsum nas 'byung bar byed do //
translated: The faculty of wisdom causes the emergence from the three realms, based on the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: de'i phyir na yang dbang po lnga nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang dbang po lnga nyid du bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the five faculties are explained.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po lnga rnams rim pa de ltar bkod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po lnga rnams rim pa de ltar bkod ce na /
translated: Why are the five faculties arranged in that order?

original: smras pa / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa ni dad pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa ni dad pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: It is said: The faculty of faith is the seed of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: de bas na dad pa'i dbang po dang por gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa'i dbang po dang por gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the faculty of faith is placed first.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: khron pa brkos nas chu 'byung bar dad pa rnams khron pa brko bar bya ba'i phyir las brtsams pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i nyes pa mthong zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan la dad nas mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brtson
analyzed: khron pa brkos nas chu 'byung bar dad pa rnams khron pa brko bar bya ba'i phyir las brtsams pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i nyes pa mthong zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan la dad nas mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brtson
translated: just as those who have faith in the appearance of water after digging a well begin the work of digging the well, likewise, having seen the faults of sa·πÉsƒÅra and having faith in the virtues of nirvƒÅ·πáa, they strive to understand nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: They begin effort.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus kyi dbang po bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus kyi dbang po bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the faculty of effort is taught after that.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams la dran pa nyams pa mi srid de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams la dran pa nyams pa mi srid de /
translated: For those who have begun striving, it is impossible for mindfulness to deteriorate.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu dran pa'i dbang po'o //üîΩdran pa ma nyams na rtag tu @113a * //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu dran pa'i dbang po'o // dran pa ma nyams na rtag tu @113a * //
translated: Therefore, the faculty of mindfulness is taught next.

original: sems rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: When mindfulness does not deteriorate, the mind always becomes one-pointed.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the faculty of concentration is taught next.

original: sems ma yengs rtse gcig tu gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur bas tha mar shes rab kyi dbang po bshad do //
analyzed: sems ma yengs rtse gcig tu gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur bas tha mar shes rab kyi dbang po bshad do //
translated: When the mind is undistracted and one-pointed, nirvana is realized. Therefore, the faculty of wisdom is explained last.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dad pa ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dad pa ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Alternatively, faith in the four noble truths is the faculty of faith.

original: dad pa rnams bden pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa rnams bden pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The beginning of application for the purpose of comprehending the truths is the faculty of striving.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dag bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid mi brjed par byed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dag bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid mi brjed par byed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: For those endowed with striving, the non-forgetting of the characteristics of the four truths is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: bden pa bzhi la sems rtse gcig tu sgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la sems rtse gcig tu sgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the one-pointedness of mind that meditates on the four noble truths.

original: bden pa bzhi shes par gyur pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi shes par gyur pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: yang na yon tan rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i rgyal po ni rgyal po'i sde gzhan 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: yang na yon tan rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i rgyal po ni rgyal po'i sde gzhan 'joms par byed do //
translated: Or, a king who has five qualities conquers other armies.

original: yon tan rnam pa lnga 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa lnga 'di lta ste /
translated: The five qualities are as follows:

original: blon po mdzangs pa dang / gnas dang sa gzhi btsan pa dang / go cha dang mtshon cha rno ba dang / g-yog 'khor mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: blon po mdzangs pa dang / gnas dang sa gzhi btsan pa dang / go cha dang mtshon cha rno ba dang / g-yog 'khor mi phyed pa'o //
translated: he has wise ministers, a strong location and land, sharp armor and weapons, and an undivided retinue.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sde rnams 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sde rnams 'joms par byed de /
translated: Similarly, a yogi who has five qualities conquers the armies of the afflictions.

original: de la shes rab kyi dbang po blon po lta bur gyur pa dang ldan pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas dang ; sa gzhi la brten pa dang / dran pa mi brjed pa'i go cha dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus brtan pa'i mtshon cha rno ba dang /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi dbang po blon po lta bur gyur pa dang ldan pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas dang ; sa gzhi la brten pa dang / dran pa mi brjed pa'i go cha dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus brtan pa'i mtshon cha rno ba dang /
translated: The faculty of wisdom is like a minister, meditative concentration is like a foundation or ground, and mindfulness is like armor that is never forgotten.

original: dad pa mi bskyod pa'i g-yog 'khor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa mi bskyod pa'i g-yog 'khor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Diligence is like a sharp weapon, and faith is like an unshakable retinue.

original: de la mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po dang / shes pa'i dbang po dang / shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po gsum bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po dang / shes pa'i dbang po dang / shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po gsum bstan par bya ste /
translated: The three faculties of knowing what is not known, knowing, and having known should be explained.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam na yid dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste rdzas dgu la ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam na yid dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste rdzas dgu la ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag ste /
translated: The path of seeing has nine substances: the mental faculty, the faculties of mental pleasure, equanimity, faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the faculty of knowing what is not known?

original: mthong ba'i lam la bden pa bzhi sngon kun tu ma shes pa rdzas dgu po rnams kyis shes pa dang reg pa dang khong du chud pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pas na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bden pa bzhi sngon kun tu ma shes pa rdzas dgu po rnams kyis shes pa dang reg pa dang khong du chud pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pas na /
translated: On the path of seeing, the nine substances of the four truths that were not previously known are to be known, contacted, comprehended, and realized, and since one begins to do that,

original: gang zag de'i dbang po ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag go //
analyzed: gang zag de'i dbang po ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag go //
translated: the faculties of that person are posited as faculties of knowing what was not previously known.

original: @113b rdzas dgu po de dag nyid sgom pa'i lam gyi dus na ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: @113b rdzas dgu po de dag nyid sgom pa'i lam gyi dus na ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Those nine substances are posited as faculties of knowing on the path of meditation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgom pa'i lam na bden pa bzhi sngon kun tu ma shes pa rdzas dgu po rnams kyis shes pa dang / rig pa dang / khong du chud pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pas na /
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam na bden pa bzhi sngon kun tu ma shes pa rdzas dgu po rnams kyis shes pa dang / rig pa dang / khong du chud pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pas na /
translated: On the path of meditation, the nine substances of the four truths that were not previously known are to be known, understood, comprehended, and realized, and since one begins to do that,

original: gang zag de'i dbang po ni shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag go //
analyzed: gang zag de'i dbang po ni shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag go //
translated: the faculties of that person are posited as faculties of knowing what was not previously known.

original: rdzas dgu po de dag nyid sgom pa'i lam gyi dus na ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rdzas dgu po de dag nyid sgom pa'i lam gyi dus na ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Those nine substances are posited as the faculty of knowing on the path of meditation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sgom pa'i lam na ni sngon ma mthong ba mthong bar bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam na ni sngon ma mthong ba mthong bar bya ba med kyi /
translated: On the path of meditation, there is nothing to be seen that has not been seen before.

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal ma lus par spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal ma lus par spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to abandon all latent states to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: mthong ba'i lam na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa de nyid yang nas yang du goms shing shes par byed pas na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa de nyid yang nas yang du goms shing shes par byed pas na /
translated: the knowledge of the four truths of the ƒÅryas on the path of seeing is cultivated again and again and made known.

original: sgom pa'i lam gyi gang zag gi dbang po dgu po rnams la ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam gyi gang zag gi dbang po dgu po rnams la ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore the nine faculties of the person on the path of meditation are posited as the faculty of knowing.

original: rdzas dgu po de nyid mi slob pa'i lam gyi dus na ni /
analyzed: rdzas dgu po de nyid mi slob pa'i lam gyi dus na ni /
translated: Those nine substances on the path of no learning

original: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: are called the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mi slob pa'i lam gyi tshe ngas bden pa bzhi kun shes so zhes khong du chud pa dang / rigs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gyi tshe ngas bden pa bzhi kun shes so zhes khong du chud pa dang / rigs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of the path of no learning, one has the understanding ‚ÄúI have fully understood the four truths‚Äù and is endowed with the wisdom of reasoning, so it is called the faculty of possessing full knowing.

original: yang na kun shes pa'i chos yongs su srung ba dang skyod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can bas shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: yang na kun shes pa'i chos yongs su srung ba dang skyod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can bas shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ste /
translated: Or, it is the faculty of possessing full knowing because it has the nature of protecting and moving the qualities of full knowing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi slob pa'i lam gyi tshe zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pas bdag gi sdug bsngal shes par bya bas yang shes par byar med /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gyi tshe zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pas bdag gi sdug bsngal shes par bya bas yang shes par byar med /
translated: At the time of the path of no learning, one obtains the wisdom of exhaustion and nonarising, so one has the quality of thinking, ‚ÄúThere is no more suffering to be known by me.

original: kun 'byung spangs pas yang spang du med /
analyzed: kun 'byung spangs pas yang spang du med /
translated: There is no more origin to be abandoned.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas pas yang mngon du byar med /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas pas yang mngon du byar med /
translated: There is no more cessation to be actualized.

original: lam bsgoms pas yang bsgom du med ces bya ba'i chos dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam bsgoms pas yang bsgom du med ces bya ba'i chos dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no more path to be cultivated.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di skad du mthong ba dang sgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam na rim bzhin du rdzas dgu po de dag nyid phan tshun du ltos nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du mthong ba dang sgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam na rim bzhin du rdzas dgu po de dag nyid phan tshun du ltos nas /
translated: This is explained as follows: On the paths of seeing, cultivation, and no learning, those nine substances are mutually dependent.

original: mi gzhan dang gzhan du rtag pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gzhan dang gzhan du rtag pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are permanent in the sense of being different from other persons.

original: rdzas dgu po de dag lam gsum po'i tshe ldan no zhes smos pa yang tshogs gzhan la ltos nas smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rdzas dgu po de dag lam gsum po'i tshe ldan no zhes smos pa yang tshogs gzhan la ltos nas smras pa yin gyi /
translated: The statement that those nine substances exist on the three paths is made in terms of other collections.

original: skad cig ma gcig gam dus gcig tu ni rdzas dgu po cig car mi @114a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gam dus gcig tu ni rdzas dgu po cig car mi @114a * //
translated: The nine substances do not occur simultaneously in one moment or at one time.

original: 'byung ngo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ngo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba la gang yang rung ba gcig 'byung gi gsum car dus gcig tu cig car 'byung mi srid do //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba la gang yang rung ba gcig 'byung gi gsum car dus gcig tu cig car 'byung mi srid do //
translated: Because it is impossible for three feelings pleasure, mental pleasure, and equanimity to occur simultaneously.

original: ji lta zhe na gal te lam mi thob tu mi rung ba dang bsam gtan gyi bar dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi sar rtogs pa yin na ni de na btang snyoms kyi tshor ba nyid yod kyi /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na gal te lam mi thob tu mi rung ba dang bsam gtan gyi bar dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi sar rtogs pa yin na ni de na btang snyoms kyi tshor ba nyid yod kyi /
translated: If it is realized on the level of the unobtainable path, the intermediate concentration, the fourth concentration, the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, or the base of nothingness, then there is the sensation of equanimity there.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang po med do //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang po med do //
translated: But there is neither the faculty of pleasure nor the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: gal te bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa yin na ni de na yid bde ba'i dbang po nyid yod kyi /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa yin na ni de na yid bde ba'i dbang po nyid yod kyi /
translated: If it is realized on the level of the first or second concentration, then there is the faculty of mental satisfaction there.

original: bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po med do //
analyzed: bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po med do //
translated: But there is neither the faculty of pleasure nor the faculty of equanimity.

original: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yin pa ni de na bde ba'i dbang po nyid yod kyi /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yin pa ni de na bde ba'i dbang po nyid yod kyi /
translated: If it is realized on the level of the third concentration, then there is the faculty of pleasure there.

original: yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po med do //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po med do //
translated: But there is neither the faculty of mental satisfaction nor the faculty of equanimity.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni mi shes pa la shes pa la shes so ba'i dbang po dang ; shes pa'i dbang po dang / shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po gsum ma gtogs pa'i dbang po gzhan thams cad yod do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni mi shes pa la shes pa la shes so ba'i dbang po dang ; shes pa'i dbang po dang / shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po gsum ma gtogs pa'i dbang po gzhan thams cad yod do //
translated: In the realm of desire, all the faculties exist, with the exception of three: the faculty of ignorance, the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown, and the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po med do //
translated: In the realm of form, the faculties of men and women, the nose and the tongue, are absent.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / kha zas kham gyis za ba dang / chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yang med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / kha zas kham gyis za ba dang / chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yang med do //
translated: The faculty of suffering is also absent, because there is no longer any attachment to pleasure, nor any food by the mouthfuls, and because beings are detached.

original: lus shin tu dang bas phyi'i yul gyis gnod pa med pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu dang bas phyi'i yul gyis gnod pa med pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is very pure, and external objects do not harm it; there is no longer any ripening of bad actions.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang med de /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang med de /
translated: The faculty of mental sorrow is also absent,

original: zhi gnas kyi sems kyi rgyud rtag tu dang ba dang gnyen por bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi sems kyi rgyud rtag tu dang ba dang gnyen por bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the stream of thought is always calm and clear, and because it is the antidote to the mental sorrow.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / yid dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang brgyad yod kyi gzhan med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / yid dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang brgyad yod kyi gzhan med do //
translated: In the formless realm, there are eight: the five such as faith, the mental faculty, the sensation of equanimity, and the vitality faculty.

original: yang na rigs kyi sa la gnod pa'i tshe 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: yang na rigs kyi sa la gnod pa'i tshe 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po ste /
translated: Or, when abiding on the stage of potential, the five faculties such as faith are the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, because one enters in order to realize the four noble truths when one has not realized them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bden pa ma shes pa rnams shes par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa ma shes pa rnams shes par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one should apply oneself, thinking, I will understand the truths that I have not understood.

original: slob pa'i sa la bden pa bzhi khong du @114b chud par 'gyur ba'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga la ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa la bden pa bzhi khong du @114b chud par 'gyur ba'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga la ni shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: The five faculties such as faith that lead to the realization of the four noble truths on the stage of learning are called the faculty of understanding.

original: shes bya shes par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya shes par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects of understanding are understood.

original: mi slob pa'i sa na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sa na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: On the level of no more learning, it is in order to abide in bliss in this visible world.

original: de'i tshe dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: On the stage of no-more-learning, the five faculties of faith, etc., are called the faculty of the state of knowing,

original: shes bya ma lus par shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya ma lus par shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not divorced from knowledge,üîΩbecause they are endowed with knowledge of all knowables.

original: yang na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag rnams kyi dbang po ni mi shes pa shes par bya bya ba'i 'jug pas ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag rnams kyi dbang po ni mi shes pa shes par bya bya ba'i 'jug pas ni mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang por gzhag go //
translated: Or, the faculties of persons who are followers of faith are posited as the faculty of the state of knowing, because they are engaged in making the unknown known.

original: rgyun du 'jug pa nas dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa'i bar gyi gang zag rnams kyi dbang po ni bden par shes par 'gyur bas shes pa'i dbang por gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyun du 'jug pa nas dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa'i bar gyi gang zag rnams kyi dbang po ni bden par shes par 'gyur bas shes pa'i dbang por gzhag go //
translated: The faculties of persons who are stream-enterers, etc., are posited as the faculty of the state of knowing, because they are engaged in knowing the truths.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: The faculties of arhats who have attained the result of arhatshipüîΩare posited as the faculty of the state of having known, because they are engaged in the state of having known.

original: mi slob pa'i sa la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi dbang po ni kun shes pa mi mnyam pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sa la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi dbang po ni kun shes pa mi mnyam pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculties of the persons who are in the stage of the adept are called the faculty of final knowledge, because they are not separated from the knowledge of the destruction and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: dbang po 'di dag gsum ci'i phyir rim pa 'di ltar bkod ce na /
analyzed: dbang po 'di dag gsum ci'i phyir rim pa 'di ltar bkod ce na /
translated: Why are these three faculties arranged in this order?üîΩThe first is the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown, because, when the wheel of the doctrine is turned for the first time, the four truths are turned in this order:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal /
translated: this is unsatisfactoriness,

original: 'di ni kun 'byung /
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung /
translated: this is the origin,

original: 'di ni 'gog pa /üîΩ'di ni lam zhes chos kyi 'khor lo dang por rnam par bzhir bskor ba na dbang po dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa / 'di ni lam zhes chos kyi 'khor lo dang por rnam par bzhir bskor ba na dbang po dang po ste /
translated: this is cessation,üîΩthis is the path.

original: mi shes pa la shes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa la shes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The second is the faculty of perfect knowledge, because, when the wheel of the doctrine is turned a second time, the four truths are turned in this order:

original: sdug bsngal shes par bya /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes par bya /
translated: unsatisfactoriness should be known,

original: kun 'byung spang bar bya ba /
analyzed: kun 'byung spang bar bya ba /
translated: the origin should be abandoned,

original: 'gog pa mngon du bya /üîΩlam bsgom par bya ba zhes chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bzhi lan gnyis la bskor ba'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du bya / lam bsgom par bya ba zhes chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bzhi lan gnyis la bskor ba'i tshe na ni /
translated: cessation should be realized,üîΩthe path should be practiced.

original: dbang po gnyis te /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis te /
translated: The third is the faculty of final and perfect knowledge, because, when the wheel of the doctrine is turned a third time, the four truths are turned in this order:üîΩunsatisfactoriness is known,üîΩthe origin is abandoned,

original: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po dang / shes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po dang / shes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: cessation is realized,üîΩthe path is practiced.

original: sdug bsngal shes par byas pas da shes par bya mi dgos /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes par byas pas da shes par bya mi dgos /
translated: Since suffering has been understood, it need not be understood again.

original: kun 'byung spangs par byas pas da spang mi dgos /
analyzed: kun 'byung spangs par byas pas da spang mi dgos /
translated: Since origin has been abandoned, it need not be abandoned again.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas pas da mngon du bya mi dgos /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas pas da mngon du bya mi dgos /
translated: Since cessation has been manifested, it need not be manifested again.üîΩSince the path has been cultivated, it need not be cultivated again.üîΩWhen the wheel of Dharma is turned in four aspects three times, the three faculties are posited:

original: lam bsgom pas da bsgom mi dgos zhes chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bzhi lan gsum du bskor ba'i tshe na ni dbang po gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: lam bsgom pas da bsgom mi dgos zhes chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bzhi lan gsum du bskor ba'i tshe na ni dbang po gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: the faculty of understanding,üîΩthe faculty of having understood,

original: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: and the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge.

original: de la mi shes pa la shes so shes bya ba'i dbang po'i dus na ni thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la mi shes pa la shes so shes bya ba'i dbang po'i dus na ni thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: At the time of the faculty of understanding, which is called ‚Äúunderstanding what was not previously understood,‚Äù it is initially virtuous.

original: shes pa'i dbang po'i dus na ni bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang po'i dus na ni bar du dge ba'o //
translated: At the time of the faculty of understanding, it is virtuous in the middle.

original: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dus na ni tha mar dge ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dus na ni tha mar dge ba ste /
translated: At the time of the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge, it is virtuous in the end.

original: de'i phyir yang rim pa de ltar bkod do //üîΩtshul @115a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rim pa de ltar bkod do //üîΩtshul @115a * //
translated: Therefore they are also arranged in that order.

original: khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po la gnas pa'i tshe na mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po la gnas pa'i tshe na mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: When one is in the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, and the aggregate of wisdom, then the faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the faculty.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po la gnas pa'i tshe na ni shes pa'i dbang po'o //üîΩrnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po la gnas pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po la gnas pa'i tshe na ni shes pa'i dbang po'o // rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po la gnas pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: When one is in the aggregate of liberation, then the faculty of understanding is the faculty.

original: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: When one is in the aggregate of the vision of the awareness of liberation, then the faculty of the awareness of understanding is the faculty.

original: de la dbang po'i don ci zhes smras pa /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i don ci zhes smras pa /
translated: What is the meaning of faculty?

original: dbang po'i don ni rgya gar skad du ain dra ya zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i don ni rgya gar skad du ain dra ya zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of faculty is found in the Indian language as indriya.

original: ain dra ya'i don du ni phyug pa'am /
analyzed: ain dra ya'i don du ni phyug pa'am /
translated: The meaning of indriya is rich or

original: dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang byed pa ste /
translated: ruling.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of faculty is the meaning of ruling over objects such as form.

original: 'o na dbang po gang dag yul gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na dbang po gang dag yul gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: Now, which faculties rule over which objects?

original: mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du lnga ni don rnam par bzhi la dbang byed pas dbang po'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du lnga ni don rnam par bzhi la dbang byed pas dbang po'o //
translated: The five faculties from the eye faculty to the body faculty are faculties because they exercise controlling power with regard to four things.

original: de la thang cig mig dang rna ba gnyis po don rnam pa bzhi la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de la thang cig mig dang rna ba gnyis po don rnam pa bzhi la dbang byed do //
translated: The eye and ear faculties exercise controlling power with regard to four things in a single moment.

original: don rnam pa bzhi ni rang gi ngo bo mdzes par byas pa dang / rang gi ngo bo srung ba dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa dang bcas pa bskyed pa dang / thun mongs ma yin pa'i rgyu la dbang byed do //
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi ni rang gi ngo bo mdzes par byas pa dang / rang gi ngo bo srung ba dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa dang bcas pa bskyed pa dang / thun mongs ma yin pa'i rgyu la dbang byed do //
translated: The four things are: beautifying one's own person, protecting one's own person, generating consciousness and the concomitant factors, and exercising controlling power over the uncommon cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo mdzes pa la dbang byed pa ni mig dang rna ba'i dbang po med na long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i gzugs shin tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mdzes pa la dbang byed pa ni mig dang rna ba'i dbang po med na long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i gzugs shin tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye and ear faculties exercise controlling power over beautifying one's own person because a blind or deaf person is not attractive.

original: rang gi ngo bo srung ba la byed pa ni nyams pa'i gnas dag mig gis mthong zhing rna bas thos nas yongs su spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo srung ba la byed pa ni nyams pa'i gnas dag mig gis mthong zhing rna bas thos nas yongs su spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They exercise controlling power over protecting one's own person because when one sees with the eye and hears with the ear, one avoids a place that is a basis for harm.

original: rnam par shes pa ldan pa dang bcas pa bskyed pa la dbang byed pa ni mig dang rna ba'i dbang po'i mthus /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ldan pa dang bcas pa bskyed pa la dbang byed pa ni mig dang rna ba'i dbang po'i mthus /
translated: The eye and ear faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the generation of consciousness and its concomitants,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba dang ldan pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba dang ldan pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they generate the eye and ear consciousnesses and their concomitant mental factors.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu la dbang byed pa ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu la dbang byed pa ni /
translated: They exercise controlling power with regard to the uncommon cause,

original: gzugs kyang mig gi dbang po nyid kyis mthong gi dbang po gzhan gyis ma yin pa dang / sgra yang rna ba'i dbang pos thos kyi dbang po gzhan gyis mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyang mig gi dbang po nyid kyis mthong gi dbang po gzhan gyis ma yin pa dang / sgra yang rna ba'i dbang pos thos kyi dbang po gzhan gyis mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form is seen by the eye faculty itself and not by another faculty, and sound is heard by the ear faculty and not by another faculty.

original: sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po yang don rnam pa bzhi la dbang byed de /
analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po yang don rnam pa bzhi la dbang byed de /
translated: The nose, tongue, and body faculties also exercise controlling power with regard to four objects.

original: rang gi ngo bo mdzes pa la dbang byed pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mdzes pa la dbang byed pa ni //
translated: They exercise controlling power with regard to the beauty of their own nature,

original: sna'i dbang po dang lce'i dbang po dang lus kyi dbang po dang mi ldan pa rnams gzugs rab tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po dang lce'i dbang po dang lus kyi dbang po dang mi ldan pa rnams gzugs rab tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who lack the nose, tongue, and body faculties do not have a beautiful form.

original: rang @115b gi ngo bo srung ba la dbang byed pa ni /
analyzed: rang @115b gi ngo bo srung ba la dbang byed pa ni /
translated: The faculty of controlling one's own nature is

original: kham gyis za ba'i kham zas dang dri dang reg bya'i khyad par gyis lus brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gyis za ba'i kham zas dang dri dang reg bya'i khyad par gyis lus brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the material food of morsels and the special qualities of smell and tactility cause the body to grow.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang bcas pa skyed pa la dbang byed pa ni sna dang / lce la sogs pa dbang po'i mthus sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba dang bcas pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang bcas pa skyed pa la dbang byed pa ni sna dang / lce la sogs pa dbang po'i mthus sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba dang bcas pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of controlling the generation of consciousness and what is associated with it is because the nose, tongue, etc., generate the nose consciousness, etc., along with their associated mental factors, by the power of the sense faculties.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu la dbang byed pa ni dri sna'i dbang po nyid kyis tshor ba dang / ro lce'i dbang po nyid kyis myang ba dang / reg bya lus kyi dbang po nyid kyis tshor ba ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu la dbang byed pa ni dri sna'i dbang po nyid kyis tshor ba dang / ro lce'i dbang po nyid kyis myang ba dang / reg bya lus kyi dbang po nyid kyis tshor ba ste /
translated: The faculty of controlling the uncommon cause is because smell is experienced by the nose faculty, taste is experienced by the tongue faculty, and tactility is experienced by the body faculty,

original: dbang po gzhan gyis byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyis byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other faculties cannot perform these functions.

original: yid kyi dbang po dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / tshor ba'i dbang po gzhi ni so sor don rnam pa gnyis la dbang byed pas dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / tshor ba'i dbang po gzhi ni so sor don rnam pa gnyis la dbang byed pas dbang po'o //
translated: the mental faculty, the female faculty, the male faculty, and the five faculties beginning with faith.üîΩThe faculties of the female and male sexual organs exercise controlling power with regard to the differentiation of species.üîΩThe faculty of life force exercises controlling power with regard to the duration of a life-stream and the experience of the evolutionary effects of actions.

original: de la thang cig skyes pa dang / bud med kyi dbang po ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de //
analyzed: de la thang cig skyes pa dang / bud med kyi dbang po ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de //
translated: The faculties of feeling exercise controlling power with regard to the experience of the evolutionary effects of actions.üîΩThe five faculties beginning with faith exercise controlling power with regard to the attainment of purity.

original: ji ltar skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po dang mi ldan pa ma ning dang za ma la sogs pa sdom pa ma yin pa dang / mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa yang med pa dang / sdom pa dang 'bras bu thob pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams su mi 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po dang mi ldan pa ma ning dang za ma la sogs pa sdom pa ma yin pa dang / mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa yang med pa dang / sdom pa dang 'bras bu thob pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams su mi 'gyur ba na'o //
translated: The faculty of coming to know what is not yet known exercises controlling power with regard to the realization of the fruit of entering the stream.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po yang don rnam pa gnyis la dbang byed de /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po yang don rnam pa gnyis la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of perfect knowledge exercises controlling power with regard to the realization of the fruit of the once-returner.üîΩThe faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge exercises controlling power with regard to the realization of the fruit of the non-returner.üîΩThe faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge exercises controlling power with regard to the realization of the fruit of arhatship.

original: ris gcig pa'i sems can rigs so sor skal ba mnyam pa rgyun du 'brel ba la dbang byed pa dang / de mi nyams par 'dzin pa la dbang byed de //
analyzed: ris gcig pa'i sems can rigs so sor skal ba mnyam pa rgyun du 'brel ba la dbang byed pa dang / de mi nyams par 'dzin pa la dbang byed de //
translated: It is the controlling power over the retention of that continuity without degeneration.

original: ji srid du 'tsho ba'i dbang po yod kyi bar du ris gcig pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i skad cig mi'i ris mthun par gnas la /
analyzed: ji srid du 'tsho ba'i dbang po yod kyi bar du ris gcig pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i skad cig mi'i ris mthun par gnas la /
translated: As long as the faculty of life force exists, the moments of the similarity of type of sentient beings of the same class remain in the continuity of the same type.

original: 'tsho ba'i 'du byed kyang mi 'jig par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i 'du byed kyang mi 'jig par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is the controlling power over the retention of the formative factors of life without destruction.

original: yid kyi dbang po yang don rnam pa gnyis la dbang byed de yang srid pa 'brel ba dang dbang du gyur pa'o //üîΩyang srid pa 'brel ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yid dam /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po yang don rnam pa gnyis la dbang byed de yang srid pa 'brel ba dang dbang du gyur pa'o // yang srid pa 'brel ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yid dam /
translated: The mental faculty is the controlling power over two objects: the connection with renewed existence and mastery.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i yid kyis skye ba'i mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i yid kyis skye ba'i mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The connection with renewed existence is the connection with birth through the mind that is free from attachment or the mind that possesses aversion.üîΩMastery is the controlling power over the arising of the various mental factors such as faith and so on.

original: dbang du gyur ba ni 'jig rten 'di dag sems kyi khrid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang du gyur ba ni 'jig rten 'di dag sems kyi khrid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThese worldly states are led by the mind.‚Äù

original: gang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga dang / dad pa'i dbang po nas shes @116a * //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga dang / dad pa'i dbang po nas shes @116a * //
translated: The five such as the faculty of pain and the five such as faithüîΩ

original: pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos gnyis la dbang byed de /
analyzed: pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos gnyis la dbang byed de /
translated: The five faculties of pain and so on and the five faculties of faith and so on are dominant conditions for both afflicted and pure phenomena.

original: ji lta na sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga las bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gnyis kyis 'dod chags bag la nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: ji lta na sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga las bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gnyis kyis 'dod chags bag la nyal bar byed do //
translated: How so? The two faculties of pleasure and mental satisfaction respectively nourish attachment.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gnyis kyis zhe sdang bag la nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gnyis kyis zhe sdang bag la nyal bar byed do //
translated: The two faculties of pain and mental dissatisfaction respectively nourish aversion.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang pos ni gti mug bag la nyal bar byed do //üîΩyang na mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du lnga po dag ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang pos ni gti mug bag la nyal bar byed do // yang na mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du lnga po dag ni /
translated: The faculty of equanimity nourishes delusion.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang rang gi yul la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang rang gi yul la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
translated: Or, the five faculties from the eye faculty to the body faculty are faculties because they dominate their own objects such as form.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i sgo nas chos kun la byed pas na dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i sgo nas chos kun la byed pas na dbang po'o //
translated: The mental faculty is the faculty with regard to all phenomena, because it is the cause of all phenomena.

original: bud med kyi dbang po ni bud med kyi ngo bo la dbyang byed de bud med kyi ngo bo ni byad lag dang / nga ro dang / bsam pa dang / spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bud med kyi dbang po ni bud med kyi ngo bo la dbyang byed de bud med kyi ngo bo ni byad lag dang / nga ro dang / bsam pa dang / spyod pa ste /
translated: The female faculty is the faculty with regard to the nature of a woman, because it is the cause of the nature of a woman. The nature of a woman is her body, voice, mind, and behavior.

original: bud med kyi dbang pos dbang byed do ;
analyzed: bud med kyi dbang pos dbang byed do ;
translated: The female faculty is the cause of these.

original: / de la byad lag ni stod phra smad sbom la nu ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: / de la byad lag ni stod phra smad sbom la nu ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The body is slender in the upper part and thick in the lower part, and has breasts.

original: nga ro ni 'jam zhing mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: nga ro ni 'jam zhing mnyen pa'o //
translated: The voice is soft and gentle.

original: bsam pa ni bud med thams cad kyang skyes pa la sems gtod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni bud med thams cad kyang skyes pa la sems gtod pa'o //
translated: The mind is that all women are intent on men.

original: spyod pa ni bud med thams cad kyang spyod pa mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni bud med thams cad kyang spyod pa mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: The behavior is that all women are impure.

original: skyes pa'i dbang po ni skyes pa'i ngo bo thams cad la dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po ni skyes pa'i ngo bo thams cad la dbang byed pa ste /
translated: The male faculty is the faculty with regard to the nature of a man, because it is the cause of the nature of a man.

original: de la skyes pa'i ngo bo yang byad lag dang bsam pa dang spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la skyes pa'i ngo bo yang byad lag dang bsam pa dang spyod pa ste /
translated: The nature of a man is his body, mind, and behavior.

original: de la skyes pa'i dbang pos dbang byed do //
analyzed: de la skyes pa'i dbang pos dbang byed do //
translated: The male faculty is the cause of these.

original: de la byad lag ni stod sbom pa'o //
analyzed: de la byad lag ni stod sbom pa'o //
translated: The faculty of hands is the upper part of the body, which is thick.

original: nga ro ni sgra che la zab pa'o //
analyzed: nga ro ni sgra che la zab pa'o //
translated: The faculty of voice is the great and deep sound.

original: bsam pa ni skyes pa kun kyang bud med la sems 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni skyes pa kun kyang bud med la sems 'jug pa'o //
translated: The faculty of thought is the mind of all men which is directed towards women.

original: spyod pa ni skyes pa kun kyang spyod pa gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni skyes pa kun kyang spyod pa gtsang ba'o //
translated: The faculty of action is the pure action of all men.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po ni gcig pa'i skal pa mnyam par gnas par bya ba la dbang byed do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po ni gcig pa'i skal pa mnyam par gnas par bya ba la dbang byed do //
translated: The faculty of life force is the power to remain in the same life-stream.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po la sogs pa lnga ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed de /
translated: The five faculties beginning with that of suffering are the power with regard to defilement.

original: ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The power with regard to defilement is as explained above.

original: kha cig na re lnga po de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re lnga po de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some say that these five are the power with regard to purification.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu las dad pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu las dad pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, faith arises from the cause of suffering.

original: bde ba las sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba las sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: From happiness, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: yid bde ba dang mi bde ba'i dbang po yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la @116b dmigs pa las 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mi bde ba'i dbang po yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la @116b dmigs pa las 'byung bar byed do //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure and the faculty of mental pain also arise from the path of nirvana.

original: 'di ltar lam la dmigs na ni bde ba skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam la dmigs na ni bde ba skye'o //
translated: For, when one focuses on the path, mental pleasure arises.

original: lam la dmigs par ma byas na ni bdag gis ma byas so zhes yid mi bde ba skye'o //
analyzed: lam la dmigs par ma byas na ni bdag gis ma byas so zhes yid mi bde ba skye'o //
translated: When one does not focus on the path, mental pain arises, thinking, ‚ÄúI have not done what should be done.‚Äù

original: nam kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: nam kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: When one abandons the afflictions,

original: lam lhun gyis grub pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mi bde ba gnyi ga mi dmigs so //
analyzed: lam lhun gyis grub pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mi bde ba gnyi ga mi dmigs so //
translated: one does not focus on either pleasure or mental pleasure or mental pain, because the path is spontaneous.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la dbang byed do //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la dbang byed do //
translated: The five faculties of faith, etc., exercise controlling power over the side of purification.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa lngas ni nyon mongs 'jil bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa lngas ni nyon mongs 'jil bar byed do //
translated: For, by means of the five, faith, etc., which are included in the mundane path, one suppresses the afflictions.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs bzhir gtogs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni lam la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs bzhir gtogs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni lam la 'jug par byed de /
translated: The five, faith, etc., which are included in the four stages of the path of insight, cause one to enter the path,

original: de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path of insight arises immediately after them.

original: mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po ni shes pa'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
analyzed: mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po ni shes pa'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of I know completely controls the faculty of knowing,

original: de'i rjes la shes pa'i dbang po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la shes pa'i dbang po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faculty of knowing arises after that.

original: shes pa'i dbang po ni shes pa dang ma bral ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang po ni shes pa dang ma bral ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of knowing controls the absence of separation from knowing,

original: shes pa'i dbang po'i 'og tu shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang po'i 'og tu shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faculty of absence of separation from knowing arises after the faculty of knowing.

original: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of absence of separation from knowing controls nirvana,

original: sems rnam par ma grol bar mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
analyzed: sems rnam par ma grol bar mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob pa'i phyir ro // yang na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
translated: because one does not attain nirvana without the mind being liberated.üîΩOr, the faculty of I know completely controls the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: de'i dbang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing through the power of that faculty.

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la shes pa'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la shes pa'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of knowledge controls the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de'i mthus sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthus sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by its power, the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are eliminated.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba la shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba la shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of possessing knowledge controls abiding happily in this life.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus na rnam par grol ba'i bde ba so sor myong ba las bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus na rnam par grol ba'i bde ba so sor myong ba las bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, at the time of arhatship, there is no other function than experiencing the bliss of liberation.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis nyid du gsungs la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis nyid du gsungs la /
translated: Why are only twenty-two faculties taught?

original: mang du yang ma yin nyung du yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mang du yang ma yin nyung du yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there neither more nor fewer?üîΩIt is said: The faculties are taught to be twenty-twoüîΩfor the sake of the basis of mind, discrimination there,üîΩabiding, affliction,

original: smras pa / sems kyi rten dang der rnam par rtog pa dang gnas pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshogs dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi phyir dbang po nyi shu rtsa @117a * //
analyzed: smras pa / sems kyi rten dang der rnam par rtog pa dang gnas pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshogs dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi phyir dbang po nyi shu rtsa @117a * //
translated: the collection of purification, and the phenomena of purification.

original: gnyis kho nar bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis kho nar bshad do //
translated: The faculties are explained as being only two.

original: de la sems kyi rten ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du drug go / der rnam par rtog pa ni bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sems kyi rten ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du drug go / der rnam par rtog pa ni bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po gnyis te /
translated: Among them, the six beginning with the eye faculty are the basis of mind. The two faculties of femininity and masculinity are the cause of discrimination,

original: gnyis kyi dbang po'i sgo nas 'di ni skyes pa 'di ni bud med ces rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dbang po'i sgo nas 'di ni skyes pa 'di ni bud med ces rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because on the basis of the two sexual organs, one discriminates this is a woman, this is a man.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang pos ni gnas par byed do //üîΩ'tsho ba la sogs pa lngas ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang pos ni gnas par byed do // 'tsho ba la sogs pa lngas ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: The life faculty causes the continuity of the aggregates to remain.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lngas ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs stsogs so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lngas ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs stsogs so //
translated: The five beginning with faith cause the accumulation of purification.

original: mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang po gsum ni rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa la shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang po gsum ni rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The three faculties of the non-possession of the three types of non-learner faculties, the faculty of complete knowledge, and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge are the nature of purification.

original: yang na 'jug pa'i rten dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang / kun nas longs spyod pa dang / ldog pa'i rten dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / kun tu longs spyod pa'i phyir dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kho na las mang du yang ma bshad nyung du yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa'i rten dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang / kun nas longs spyod pa dang / ldog pa'i rten dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / kun tu longs spyod pa'i phyir dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kho na las mang du yang ma bshad nyung du yang ma bshad do //
translated: Or else, the twenty-two faculties are taught in order to indicate the basis of entry into samsara, the basis of birth, the basis of abiding, the basis of complete enjoyment, and the basis of turning away from samsara; and in order to indicate birth, abiding, complete enjoyment, and turning away.

original: de la 'khor bar 'jug pa'am yul la 'jug pa'i rten ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du drug go //
analyzed: de la 'khor bar 'jug pa'am yul la 'jug pa'i rten ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du drug go //
translated: The six beginning with the eye faculty and ending with the mind faculty are the basis of entry into samsara or the basis of entry into objects.

original: skye bar byed pa ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po gnyis te /
analyzed: skye bar byed pa ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po gnyis te /
translated: The two faculties of male and female are the basis of birth.

original: de gnyis las sems can skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis las sems can skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings are born from those two.

original: gnas pa ni tshor ba'i dbang po ste 'di'i mthus gnas par byed pas so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni tshor ba'i dbang po ste 'di'i mthus gnas par byed pas so //
translated: Feeling is the basis of abiding, because one abides through the power of feeling.

original: kun tu longs spyod pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: kun tu longs spyod pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa lnga ste /
translated: The five beginning with pain are the basis of complete enjoyment.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang pos ni tshor ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang pos ni tshor ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar byed do //
translated: One experiences the suffering of feeling through the faculties of pain and mental pain.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang pos ni tshor ba bde ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang pos ni tshor ba bde ba myong bar byed do //
translated: The faculty of pleasure and the faculty of mental pleasure experience the feeling of pleasure.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang pos ni /üîΩtshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang pos ni / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: The faculty of equanimityüîΩexperiences neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar byed do //
translated: The faculty of equanimity experiences neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i rgyu ni dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i rgyu ni dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga'o //
translated: The five faculties of faith, etc., are the cause of turning away from samsara.

original: ldog pa'i skye ba'i rgyu ni mi shes so zhes pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i skye ba'i rgyu ni mi shes so zhes pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the cause of turning away from birth.

original: de'i mthus khams gsum las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthus khams gsum las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its power, one turns away from the three realms.

original: gnas pa ni shes pa'i dbang po ste de'i tshe 'khor ba las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni shes pa'i dbang po ste de'i tshe 'khor ba las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of understanding is the cause of abiding, because at that time one abides in the path of meditation, which is characterized by turning away from samsara.

original: kun nas longs spyod pa ni shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: kun nas longs spyod pa ni shes pa dang ma bral ba'i dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the cause of complete enjoyment,

original: de'i dus na rnam par grol ba'i bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus na rnam par grol ba'i bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time one experiences the bliss of liberation.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis bshad zin to /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis bshad zin to /
translated: The twenty-two faculties have been explained.

original: // / dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis bstan pa'i @117b 'og tu bsam gtan bstan te /
analyzed: // / dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis bstan pa'i @117b 'og tu bsam gtan bstan te /
translated: After teaching the twenty-two faculties, he teaches the meditative absorptions.

original: de bas na ji ltar bsam gtan de bzhin du bshad par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar bsam gtan de bzhin du bshad par 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, since he wishes to explain the meditative absorptions just as they are,

original: bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat are the four meditative absorptions?‚Äù and so on.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i don ci /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i don ci /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúmeditative absorption‚Äù?

original: 'dis bsgom zhing bsam gtan byed pas na /
analyzed: 'dis bsgom zhing bsam gtan byed pas na /
translated: Because one meditates and contemplates by means of this,

original: bsam gtan te rab tu shes par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan te rab tu shes par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is a meditative absorption. The meaning is that one becomes fully aware.

original: de yang don du na sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig tu gzhag pa ni bsam gtan te de la mnyam par gzhag pa la rab tu shes pa zhes bya bar cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de yang don du na sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig tu gzhag pa ni bsam gtan te de la mnyam par gzhag pa la rab tu shes pa zhes bya bar cis mngon zhe na /
translated: Moreover, in reality, a meditative absorption is a mental state that is concentrated and focused one-pointedly. How do we know that it is called ‚Äúfully aware‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúOne knows things as they really are from a concentrated mind.‚Äù

original: de la bsam gtan gyi sgra'i don sems la bya mod kyi /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi sgra'i don sems la bya mod kyi /
translated: In this regard, although the meaning of the term ‚Äúmeditative absorption‚Äù is mental,

original: sems nyid 'dir shes rab la bya bar rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: sems nyid 'dir shes rab la bya bar rigs par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that the mind itself is wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mode of the Buddha's philosophical system.

original: de ni 'di skad cu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad cu bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: dge ba'i chos la sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one-pointedness of mind toward virtuous dharmas is concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the first concentration,

original: 'di ltar dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Monks, it is like this... and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Here means in this place.

original: 'dod pa'i khams 'dir gnas pa'i gang zag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams 'dir gnas pa'i gang zag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the person who dwells in this desire realm.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni bos te bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni bos te bka' stsal pa /
translated: Monks is an address, meaning it is said.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Monks means the monk who enters into the first concentration.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po de yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu nyid las skye'i /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po de yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyu nyid las skye'i /
translated: Moreover, since that first concentration is the nature of being free from the desire realm, it arises from the cause of being free from the desire of the desire realm.

original: gzhan las ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan las ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is not from another, he said:

original: 'dod pa las dben pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIsolated from desires, isolated from evil and unwholesome states.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags pa spang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags pa spang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should abandon attachment to the five sense objects of the desire realm.

original: 'dir khong khro ba ma gtogs par gong 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir khong khro ba ma gtogs par gong 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Here, except for anger, the afflictions such as attachment to the desire realm are called ‚Äúdesires‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúisolated from desires.‚Äù

original: de spangs na 'dod pa las dben pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs na 'dod pa las dben pa'o //
translated: When one abandons them, one is ‚Äúisolated from desires.‚Äù

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa zhes bya ba'i khong khro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid zhe sdang gi cha rnams dang / de'i rgyu las skyes pa'i sems @118a * //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa zhes bya ba'i khong khro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid zhe sdang gi cha rnams dang / de'i rgyu las skyes pa'i sems @118a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIsolated from evil and unwholesome states‚Äù means that one abandons the aspects of anger such as anger itself and the states that arise from its cause,

original: can la brdeg pa dang / gsod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: can la brdeg pa dang / gsod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: such as beating and killing sentient beings.

original: de la mi dge ba 'ba' zhig smos kyi /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba 'ba' zhig smos kyi /
translated: Here, only nonvirtue is mentioned,üîΩbut it should be understood that the phrase ‚Äúevil and unwholesome states‚Äù also includes neutral states.

original: sdig pa'i tshig ma smos na ni mi dge ba'i tshig 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa gzhan la yang bya ba yin pas lan gnyis su smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa'i tshig ma smos na ni mi dge ba'i tshig 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa gzhan la yang bya ba yin pas lan gnyis su smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word ‚Äúevil‚Äù is not mentioned, then the word ‚Äúnonvirtuous‚Äù would have to be repeated twice, since it applies to other afflictions of the desire realm as well.

original: de bas na sdig pa mi dge zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: de bas na sdig pa mi dge zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúevil‚Äù is mentioned.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud ma rungs par byed pas zhe sdang kha na ma tho ba che ba'i phyir sdig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud ma rungs par byed pas zhe sdang kha na ma tho ba che ba'i phyir sdig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúevil‚Äù because it is a great offense, since it makes one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mind streams unworkable.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas zhes bya ba rtog pa dpyod pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas zhes bya ba rtog pa dpyod pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is called ‚Äúcontemplation and discernment‚Äù because it is the meaning of ‚Äúcontemplation and discernment.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi chos rnams la skyon dang nyes par lta ba'i rtog pa dang dpyod par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrtsing ba dang rags par rtog pa ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi chos rnams la skyon dang nyes par lta ba'i rtog pa dang dpyod par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rtsing ba dang rags par rtog pa ni rtog pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúendowed with contemplation and discernment that views the faults and problems of phenomena in the desire realm.‚ÄùüîΩContemplation is coarse and gross discernment.

original: zhib tu 'dzin cing rtog pa ni dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhib tu 'dzin cing rtog pa ni dpyod pa'o //
translated: Discernment is subtle grasping and discernment.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe joy and pleasure born of seclusion.‚Äù

original: dben pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: dben pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúseclusion‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spang ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spang ba la bya ste /
translated: refers to the abandonment of desire and the abandonment of evil, unwholesome states.

original: de las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang ldan zhing bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang ldan zhing bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One enters and remains in the first meditative absorption, which is accompanied by investigation and analysis, and which is filled with joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i sgras dag pa dang zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la bya bar ston to //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i sgras dag pa dang zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la bya bar ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúborn of seclusion‚Äù indicates pure and uncontaminated meditative absorption.

original: dag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gtan gong ma la grol bar 'du shes la 'og ma la zug rngur 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gtan gong ma la grol bar 'du shes la 'og ma la zug rngur 'du shes pa ste /
translated: Pure meditative absorption is the meditative absorption of mundane beings, who perceive the higher meditative absorptions as freedom and the lower ones as painful.

original: bsam gtan gyi ro la chags pa dang / nga rgyal med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro la chags pa dang / nga rgyal med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is characterized by the absence of attachment to the taste of meditative absorption and the absence of pride.

original: zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas zhugs pa las thob pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩdga' ba'i sgras ni yid bde ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas zhugs pa las thob pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do // dga' ba'i sgras ni yid bde ba la bya'o //
translated: Uncontaminated meditative absorption is characterized by transcendence of the mundane, and is attained through the four noble truths.üîΩThe word ‚Äújoy‚Äù refers to mental satisfaction.

original: bde ba'i sgras ni bag yangs kyi bde ba la bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i sgras ni bag yangs kyi bde ba la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúbliss‚Äù refers to the bliss of mental and physical suppleness.

original: 'di ltar sems las su rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rjes su mthun pa'i bag yangs kyi bde ba la bde ba zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems las su rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rjes su mthun pa'i bag yangs kyi bde ba la bde ba zhes bya'i /
translated: Thus, the bliss of mental flexibility and the bliss of the ease that accompanies it are called ‚Äúbliss.‚Äù

original: tshor ba bde ba la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba la ni mi bya'o //
translated: But this is not the bliss of feeling.

original: smras pa / 'on ci'i phyir 'dir tshor ba 'di la bya'o zhes dmigs kyis phye ba med par bde ba zhes spyi tsam du smros /
analyzed: smras pa / 'on ci'i phyir 'dir tshor ba 'di la bya'o zhes dmigs kyis phye ba med par bde ba zhes spyi tsam du smros /
translated: Objection: Why is it not specified here that this is a feeling? Why is it said to be bliss in general?

original: lan du gal te tshor ba'i bde ba yin par 'dod na /üîΩlus kyi tshor ba'i bde ba'am /
analyzed: lan du gal te tshor ba'i bde ba yin par 'dod na / lus kyi tshor ba'i bde ba'am /
translated: In response, if you assert that it is the bliss of feeling,üîΩis it the bliss of physical feeling or

original: sems kyi tshor ba'i bde ba yin grang @118b na ;
analyzed: sems kyi tshor ba'i bde ba yin grang @118b na ;
translated: is it the bliss of mental feeling?

original: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na /
translated: Thus, when one enters meditative attainment,

original: lus kyi bde ba ni yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba ni yod par mi rigs te /
translated: the bliss of physical feeling is not tenable.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the five collections of consciousness do not exist at the time of meditative equipoise.

original: sems kyi bde ba yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba yang mi bya ste /
