translated: The bliss of mental feeling is also untenable.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig smos pa'i phyir dga' ba ni 'dir yid kyi bde ba la bya bas na /
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig smos pa'i phyir dga' ba ni 'dir yid kyi bde ba la bya bas na /
translated: This is because the word ‚Äújoy‚Äù is mentioned, and here joy is mental satisfaction.

original: yid kyi bde ba dngos su yod pas na /
analyzed: yid kyi bde ba dngos su yod pas na /
translated: because mental pleasure actually exists.

original: sems kyi bde ba la bya bar 'dod na ni tshig zlos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba la bya bar 'dod na ni tshig zlos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that mental pleasure is meant, then your words are redundant.

original: gal te na de'i tshe bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis ka yod do zhe na ni //
analyzed: gal te na de'i tshe bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis ka yod do zhe na ni //
translated: If you say that both pleasure and mental pleasure exist at that time,

original: de ltar na rdzas mnyam par nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas mnyam par nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then your theory is reduced to the same substance,

original: skad cig ma gcig la sems las byung ba'i rdzas gnyis 'byung mi srid pas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la sems las byung ba'i rdzas gnyis 'byung mi srid pas so //
translated: because it is impossible for two mental activities to occur in the same moment.

original: de ltar skad cig ma gcig la rdzas gnyis mi 'byung yang /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma gcig la rdzas gnyis mi 'byung yang /
translated: Even though two substances do not occur in the same moment,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni skad cig ma mang po'i rang bzhin yin pas dang po la dga' bas phyis bde ba 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni skad cig ma mang po'i rang bzhin yin pas dang po la dga' bas phyis bde ba 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: since meditative attainment has the nature of many moments, pleasure occurs later, after joy in the first moment.

original: 'o na ni bsam gtan dang po'i skad cig ma gcig la yan lag lngar bshad pa med par gyur pas mi rigs so //üîΩde bas na dga' ba'i sgras ni yid bde ba la bya la /
analyzed: 'o na ni bsam gtan dang po'i skad cig ma gcig la yan lag lngar bshad pa med par gyur pas mi rigs so // de bas na dga' ba'i sgras ni yid bde ba la bya la /
translated: But then it would be incorrect to say that there are five members in one moment of the first meditative absorption.üîΩTherefore, the term joy should be understood to mean mental pleasure,

original: bde ba'i sgras ni bag yangs kyi bde ba la bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i sgras ni bag yangs kyi bde ba la bya'o //
translated: and the term pleasure should be understood to mean the bliss of composure.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He enters and abides in the first concentration means

original: bsam gtan dang po la sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbsam gtan gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba'i don to // bsam gtan gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: that he places his mind in one-pointed equipoise in the first concentration.

original: de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the second concentration, it says having thoroughly pacified discursive thought and investigation, and so forth.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnal 'byor pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnal 'byor pa la bya ste /
translated: The word that refers to the yogi.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the yogi.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi zhes bya ba ni de gnyis dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi zhes bya ba ni de gnyis dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thoroughly pacified discursive thought and investigation means free from those two, which is to say.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs na rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i 'khrug pa dang bral bas na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs na rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i 'khrug pa dang bral bas na /
translated: When entering the second concentration, since it is free from the disturbance of discursive thought and investigation,

original: nang rab tu dang ba'i sems kyis gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ste /

translated: Alternatively, the term ‚Äúinner‚Äù

original: don ni dad pa la bya ste /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs te /

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: btang snyoms la gnas te zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de dag na rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs med pas ;
translated: The five collections of consciousness do not exist in the third meditative absorption.üîΩTherefore, the phrase ‚Äúexperiencing pleasure‚Äù means that the mind experiences pleasure.

translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe pleasure of the third meditative absorption‚Äù is illustrated by the following example.üîΩThe sutra states: ‚ÄúThe noble ones who are mindful and experience pleasure abide in equanimity.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe pleasure of the third meditative absorption‚Äù is illustrated by the following example.üîΩThe sutra states: ‚ÄúThe noble ones who are mindful and experience pleasure abide in equanimity.‚Äù

analyzed: 'phags pa de dag gis kyang btang snyoms la dran pa dang ldan zhing bde ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: The noble ones who are mindful and experience pleasure abide in equanimity.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe noble ones who are mindful and experience pleasure‚Äù means that the noble ones are those who have gone far from the mass of afflictionsüîΩand from the practice of evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni /

analyzed: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pa na bde ba spangs so ;
translated: In that case, when he attains the second meditative concentration, he abandons pleasure.

analyzed: / bsam gtan gsum pa thob pa na yid mi bde ba spangs so //

analyzed: sa 'og ma'i nyes pa'i dri ma brgyad dang bral nas btang snyoms dag pa dang dran pa dag pa zhes bya'o //

original: dri ma brgyad ni /
analyzed: dri ma brgyad ni /
translated: The eight stains are

analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid me bde ba ste brgyad do //

analyzed: rtog dpyod la sogs pa nyid @120b yan lag tu bshad kyi gzhan yod kyang yan lag tu ma bzhag go //

translated: Since one investigates and analyzes the phenomena of the desire realm as painful, like a boil, etc., they are antidotes to desire, malice, and anger and they eliminate them.

analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya bas rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag bstan te /

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyis /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyis /
translated: Since investigation and analysis are antidotes,

translated: The objects of desire have little of the taste of pleasure and much suffering.

original: nyes pa'i dmigs pa mang po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa'i dmigs pa mang po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They are associated with many faults.

original: de bsten na'ang tshim pa'am mchog gi mtha' med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bsten na'ang tshim pa'am mchog gi mtha' med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Even if you enjoy them, there is no satisfaction or limit to the supreme.

original: rnam grangs des na sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos yang dag par zhugs pa skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis rnam pa du mas smad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos yang dag par zhugs pa skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis rnam pa du mas smad pa'o //
translated: For these reasons, the Buddhas and the noble beings who are the Buddha‚Äôs disciples have in many ways condemned the objects of desire.

original: ji ltar dus tshol zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dus tshol zhe na /
translated: How do they seek the objects of desire?

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'di dag ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da @122b ltar gyi dus su rtag pa rtag par ther zug ther zug tu yang 'dod pa 'di dag ni 'tshe ba mang ba sdug bsngal mang ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'di dag ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da @122b ltar gyi dus su rtag pa rtag par ther zug ther zug tu yang 'dod pa 'di dag ni 'tshe ba mang ba sdug bsngal mang ba /
translated: These desires are always desired in the past, future, and present.üîΩThese desires are full of harm, full of suffering, and full of trouble.

original: gnod pa mang ba zhes de ltar tshol ba ni dus tshol ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa mang ba zhes de ltar tshol ba ni dus tshol ba'o //
translated: This is the search for time.

original: ji ltar rigs pas tshol zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pas tshol zhe na /
translated: How is it that one searches in accordance with reason?

original: 'dod pa 'di dag rtsol ba chen po dang / 'bad pa chen po dang ngal ba dang chad pa rnam pa du ma dang bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsgrub dgos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di dag rtsol ba chen po dang / 'bad pa chen po dang ngal ba dang chad pa rnam pa du ma dang bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsgrub dgos te /
translated: These desires must be accomplished by great effort, great striving, and many kinds of hardship and deprivation, and by various kinds of arts.

original: de ltar bsags shing brtsal ba yang bdag gi lus /
analyzed: de ltar bsags shing brtsal ba yang bdag gi lus /
translated: Even though they are accumulated and sought in this way, my body

original: gzugs can 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa rags pa rtag tu mnye ba dang bkru ba dang gso dgos shing 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par 'thor ba'i chos can las sdug bsngal tsam bsal ba'i phyir ni gnyen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs can 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa rags pa rtag tu mnye ba dang bkru ba dang gso dgos shing 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par 'thor ba'i chos can las sdug bsngal tsam bsal ba'i phyir ni gnyen por 'gyur te /
translated: is coarse, consisting of the four great elements, and must always be massaged, bathed, and nourished. It is full of fear and is subject to destruction. It is only for the sake of removing suffering that it becomes a remedy.

original: bkres pa'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni kha zas so //
analyzed: bkres pa'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni kha zas so //
translated: Food is for the purpose of removing the suffering of hunger.

original: grang ba dang dro ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dzem pa dang / ngo tsha ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni bgo ba'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dzem pa dang / ngo tsha ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni bgo ba'o //
translated: Clothing is for the purpose of removing the suffering of cold, heat, and embarrassment.

original: gnyid dang 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni mal stan to //
analyzed: gnyid dang 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni mal stan to //
translated: Beds are for the purpose of removing the suffering of sleeplessness.

original: 'chag pa dang 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni bzhon pa'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa dang 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni bzhon pa'o //
translated: Conveyances are for the purpose of removing the suffering of walking.

original: na ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni na rkyen gyi sman te /
analyzed: na ba'i sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir ni na rkyen gyi sman te /
translated: Medicines are for the purpose of removing the suffering of disease.

original: 'dod pa'i chos 'di dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po tsam du zad pas de dag la chags pa dang zhen par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chos 'di dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po tsam du zad pas de dag la chags pa dang zhen par ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be attached to or cling to these desirable things, since they are merely antidotes to suffering.

original: gzhan du na nad kyis nyen pa'i nad pa rnams nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sman la brten pa 'dra ba'i tshul du bya'o zhes tshol ba ni rigs pas tshol ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na nad kyis nyen pa'i nad pa rnams nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sman la brten pa 'dra ba'i tshul du bya'o zhes tshol ba ni rigs pas tshol ba ste /
translated: Rather, one should use them in the same way that a sick person uses medicine, for the purpose of curing the suffering.üîΩThis is the rational search.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa'i chos de dag la dngos po rnams pa drug tshol bas rags pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa'i chos de dag la dngos po rnams pa drug tshol bas rags pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par byed la /
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the coarseness of those things of the realm of desire are known through the search for the six kinds of substance.

original: bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rig par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rig par byed do //
translated: The characteristics of the calmness of the first meditation are known.

original: yid la byed pa de ni mnyan pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang 'dres pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de ni mnyan pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang 'dres pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this mental attention is mixed with the wisdom that comes from listening and reflection.

original: de'i 'og tu mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab las 'das nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab las 'das nas /
translated: After that, having gone beyond the wisdom that comes from listening and reflection,

original: gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam par 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa la rag las pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ba sgom pa na yang nas yang du ji ltar brtsal ba'i rags pa dang zhi ba la mos par byed do //üîΩde ni mngon par mos @123a * //
analyzed: gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam par 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa la rag las pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ba sgom pa na yang nas yang du ji ltar brtsal ba'i rags pa dang zhi ba la mos par byed do // de ni mngon par mos @123a * //
translated: one cultivates serenity and insight, which are focused on the coarseness and calmness that were sought, and which are dependent on the desires of the realm of desire and on the calmness of the first meditation.

original: pa can yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa can yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mental attention of one who has strong aspiration.
